Reviews.Title: Great outdoor camera
Reviews.Author: Tod P. Zechiel
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for outdoor use while kayaking. I have no intention of using it underwater, but having lost two cameras to water damage; I opted for something waterproof.Pluses:  1. The function buttons are tops - easy to find and press.  2. With tapered edges, the camera goes in my pocket easily.  3. Movie audio surprizingly good.  4. Multiple digital pixel settings - as low as 100 KB for  photos at the lowest setting - I e-mail my dad photos, he has  dial-up so short attachments are critical.  5. Photo quality color and resolution is good, including macro.  6. LCD display is good, even in strong sunlight  7. Menu choices are fairly intuitive.  8. Battery life seems good so far.  9. SD card - not that many waterproof cameras allow the use of  the common SD card.Minuses  1. Indoor shots are have noise.  2. No hardcopy, comprehensive manual, just an unbound, brief  multifolded paper.  The comprehensive manual is on a CD.  Then again, if you are around water, FUJI may figure you  aren't going to take a paper manual with you.  3. Propriety USB cable for downloads - yet another cable to  keep seperate from a dozen other propriety cables me and my  family has.Summary: The camera exceeds my expectation for outdoor use.  Granted, the photos in lower light settings have some noise, but most of my photos are in bright daylight.  If I am going to an indoor event with low light, I'll take my Canon that is not waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Buy it for vacation, but use it for every day
Reviews.Author: SUSAN LIENESCH "akamaisue"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take with me snorkeling in Hawai'i, and to use as a backup camera to my Olympus 20x zoom camera. When i first took it out in Kahalu'u Bay on the Big Island, I was amazed at what this little camera could do. It's so easy to operate underwater and takes great movies and pics. Seals are watertight and body is very sturdy. Good battery life considering how much I used it every day of my trip. I took it to a manta ray night snorkel and got some once-in-a-lifetime videos (see my youtube vid at [...]) and was glad the small size made it a great still shot backup when I ran out of batteries in my Olympus. The cool green color and nice quality vids and photos got noticed by quite a few tourists and locals on my trip. The camera's still photo quality is just fine for everyday shooting. Snap one of these beauties up now and never leave home without it.

Reviews.Title: Hawaii Amazing
Reviews.Author: Nancy Walker

} } } Length:: 0:48 MinsI rarely write reviews BUT this is the best $129 I have ever spent. I was in Hawaii in January and used the underwater capabilities of this cute LITTLE, amazingly easy to use camera. I was surprised to hear the footage of the whales underwater BETTER than I heard them in real life, AWESOME. Please watch and listen to the turtle with the whales screaming in the background, I didn't think underwater was so noisy!!! I also caught some pretty amazing photos of rainbows, even far away ones. This camera is as sweet as the price!

Reviews.Title: GREAT camera for a lot of things
Reviews.Author: Shandel "Shan"
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera underwater and on top. Sunsets and sunrises. I really like the way it handles and shoots. Very easy to figure out the settings. The easiest camera I've used so far and I've been shooting for 40 years. Sometimes I just don't want to think about settings but know I can get a great photo. I can with this camera.It's fun taking a video going down a water slide!One thing about digital is pushing the card to it's limit. I got a 4Gig. card and place the settings at the least amount of photos so it has the best quality photo. I can still get over 600 photos to this card! The other important thing is to make sure you hold the shooting button down for a few secs. so the digital camera can auto focus. If you don't photos will be blured or grainy.I would recomend this to anyone looking for a great waterproof camera.

Reviews.Title: An amazing and outstanding camera
Reviews.Author: C. Ochsner
Reviews.Content: If you're a novice at photography and want to take pictures either out of or under water, you couldn't ask for a bettter camera.  Especially for the price.  Either the people who gave this camera a bad review didn't know how to use it, they have too high a expectation, or are expert photographers who may need a more expensive camera.  Or perhaps their camera just didn't work properly.I wasn't expecting a lot from this camera based on the price and some reviews, but because of some of the shared photos, I decided to give it a try.  If it didn't work, I at least didn't spend a whole lot.  What I got was an amazing camera for a great price. I'm an extremely picky person and it takes a lot to impress me, but that is exactly what this camera did.  Since I was snorkeling and floating on top of the water bobbing up and down, fighting against the current and using mostly the zoom feature my expectation was a lot of blurred pictures.  So much so, that I wasn't even eager to get back to the ship to load the pictures onto my laptop to see what I got.  When I finally was mentally set for a big disappointment I loaded my pictures onto my laptop.  What I saw couldn't have surprised or excited me more.  The pictures were beautiful and the movies I took were phenomenal.  If you are a novice or a intermediate photographer, I highly, highly recommend this camera especially if you want to take underwater photos.  I think it does great out of the water too.  I have uploaded a few of the pictures I took so you can check those out.  My two disappointments were that it was overcast (Fugifilm has no control over that)and I think some of the photos would have been better had the sun been out showing off all the colors of the fish and coral.  And that the camera is only good for 3 meters under water.  So I wasn't able to swim to the bottom of the ocean with it to take pictures.  I had to stay on the surface.  Regardless, it had the zoom that worked perfectly.  One other nice thing was that I didn't have to worry about it if it rained or got wet while out on the ocean.

Reviews.Title: 4 Stars for a "Water-Proof" Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Bailey
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying that I am giving this camera 4 stars for a "waterproof camera"; with that in mind comparing this with other similarly priced non-water cameras I would probably rate this camera with a 2 1/2 to 3 star rating.This is actually my mom's camera, but I borrowed it over July 4th for a trip to amusement/water park. For the purpose of using it under water/around water I was impressed. The pictures came out surprisingly well. Other than that, though, I actually switched to my camera (Cannon Powershot SX100) for the non-water parts of the trip because the picture quality is much superior.Pros:*Underwater use is great, especially for a lower-priced digital camera*The automatic flash is very quick, unlike some cameras that automatically do the "three-flash" thing ... you don't miss any actions shots*Large display screen*CompactCons:*For having 10MP the out-of-water-pictures are very unimpressive (my camera is 8MP and takes exceedingly better pictures in all light settings)*The buttons are crammed into the right side (to afford more display screen room) but makes the buttons a little complicated. Further, the layout of the buttons do not feel very well thought out*In the playback mode, scrolling through pictures has a slideshow effect, which is annoying because there is a noticeable lag between each picture*This camera does not adjust well to light settings. My mom just went to the beach this weekend on a very sunny day and all the pictures appeared blown out.*Videos are even more grainy than the picturesOverall, if you need a cheap, waterproof digital camera this may be a good buy. But, if you're just looking for a digital camera that you will occasionally use for water, I would sugest buying a better regular digital camera and investing in the disposable digital under-water cameras the once or twice you want water pictures. The picture quality is too poor if you plan on using this mostly for non-water pictures.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't deliver on what it promises.
Reviews.Author: Chad Baker "darkbeach72"
Reviews.Content: I'm an easy grader and love to give positive reviews of products that perform well. So please think seriously about what I say before buying this product. I am a photography and graphics professional, but I'm really only judging this camera against my expectations for similar products in this class. [The most recent point and shoot camera that I've owned was a Panasonic Lumix DMC-FX8 5MP, purchased in 2006.]Cons:1)Poor image quality. Not worthy of the name/reputation that Fuji has earned through years of superior film products. Images are grainy in nearly all but perfectly bright outdoor settings. For digital photo professionals, I'm referring to chromatic noise in excess of anything I've seen in the last 5 years or so. I'm almost baffled that the sensor could be so poor. Indoor shots are terrible. It's almost impossible to get this camera to shoot a focused picture in anything other than midday sun or with a harsh flash that washes out the image. All shooting conditions being equal, I would prefer to have a 5 megapixel image from my Lumix rather than a 10 megapixel image from the Fuji FinePix.2)Waterproofing fails. I read a review right after I bought this camera that said that the user had experienced a problem with moisture behind the LCD display. I hoped that her experience was atypical. Unfortunately, I had the same experience. On day 9 of a 10 day trip to Mexico, the camera developed a moisture problem that affected both the LCD display and the lens. Images were completely fogged and unacceptable. I had to fully dry the camera (try that in 100% tropical humidity) in order to get it to de-fog.3)Long time (few seconds) to display image after shutter press. Can be a bit frustrating when action happens.4)Not enough manual control for iso/shutter speed/flash in difficult lighting conditions, which for this camera are most lighting conditions. I had better fine controls on my Lumix, three years ago. And better indoor/party photos on my Nikon Coolpix 880 back in the late '90s.5)LCD is difficult to read in most daylight and underwater lighting conditions. You'll find yourself trying to create a dark shadow with your other hand in order to see what you're doing, and even then it's hard to read.Pros:1)Flotation strap really works.2)Fun, easy and convenient.3)Interesting advances features like face recognition that I didn't get a chance to fully test because of Con #2 above.4)Video.I purchased this camera just before our trip to Mexico, because of the waterproof feature and because I wanted a fast/fun/easy backup to my professional grade Canon 5D mkII. I returned it immediately after the trip because of the internal moisture issue. The camera was never subjected to conditions outside of its stated range. It wasn't dropped, crushed or shocked. The deepest that camera was ever in the water was about 5 feet. We went snorkeling with it about 5 times and shot some fairly good underwater photos. Never exceeded the camera's rated depth.In conclusion, this was a camera that I really wanted to love and rave about, but the main purpose of a camera is not all the fluff and jazzy features. It's taking pictures. This camera just takes lousy pictures. The sensor creates images that are high in megapixels but otherwise more like a cell phone camera than a nice point and shoot. And its one hallmark feature, being waterproof, failed after about a week of what I would consider normal use by responsible, careful adults. I returned mine and am looking for another point-and-shoot to replace it. This could have been an AMAZING product if the sensor was better and the waterproofing didn't fail. It's a fun little camera with a really convenient form factor and easy controls, this pics just aren't good.

Reviews.Title: a Little giant!
Reviews.Author: Alex Vox
Reviews.Content: This camera is small, very nice sitting in your hand, takes nice pictures and goes under water! For as long as you know what to expect from little cam, this Fuji's baby is super sleek, stylish, very easy to handle, the buttons are very nice to the touch and superbly organized.Must say the lens is very sharp. I tested it under water and it works great.It also has dedicated movie button that is very convenient. In short it is great little cam that sits in my pocket and instantly available!

Reviews.Title: Image noise
Reviews.Author: whoareyou
Reviews.Content: The physical characteristics of this camera do not disappoint, but so far I am unhappy with the image quality.For comparison purposes I own an Olympus E-520 D-SLR and my previous point-and-shoot camera was a Casio EX-S500 from around three years ago.  I was very happy with the Casio, but someone accidentally dropped it hard and it broke, so I intend to replace it with this camera.The tiny size and lightweightness of the Fuji Z33 WP are perfect for pocket portability.  Its shape also has a much higher coolness factor than many of the standard boxy designs.  It definitely feels smaller than I imagined it would.  The interface is simple and easy to use.  The buttons remind me of car stereo head units I had in the mid-90s.  They are kind of rubbery and very pleasant to use, but they feel as if after a few years you might wear them out and accidentally poke a hole in the rubbery surface that covers the underlying button mechanisms.  I imagine that this would leave the camera with an area vulnerable to water.  The battery/memory card door seems well-constructed and you must open a latch, slide the door, and then swing it open to access the innards.  The waterproof gasket appears secure and I feel that the door design is well-engineered.  Under the door is a port which appears to be proprietary and uses a supplied cable to connect to a USB port on your computer.  This port is used to transfer pictures and videos to a different location immediately without installing any software.Also under the door is the battery which must be removed for charging.  I must say that I really like the battery charger.  It is a platform about 2x3.5x0.5" and it does not require a cord.  Prongs swing out from the back and you plug the charging platform directly into the wall.  It might not be convenient on a power strip because it would take up extra room, but I really like that there is not another extra cord for the charger.  It is very sleek and easy to pack.The majority of the camera is plastic which makes it so lightweight, but it seems relatively sturdy short of drop-testing it.  I would say that I have medium-sized male hands and this camera is pretty small to hold.  I personally prefer this characteristic because I'm looking for a camera that I can take everywhere with me.  I have my D-SLR for camera-specific outings, but I want something small and light to take with me everywhere from bars and parties to outdoor activities like snowboarding and mountain biking.  The size of the camera definitly meets my requirements, but I can see that it might be hard to hold for someone with larger hands.  Also, until you get used to it, you must be careful not to cover the lens with a finger, but I understand that this is normal for this camera category.  The On/Off button is recessed so that it isn't pressed accidentally and the shutter feels natural and requires a standard amount of pressure to activate.The menu system gives the basic options and doesn't waste space with convoluted choices.  It also gives clear explanations of the scene modes to help you decide which one to use.  The auto-scene-recognition can be engaged if you don't want to keep the picture-taking process as simple as possible.  Overall, the menu was very easy to navigate and nothing seemed confusing.I have not evaluated the underwater capabilities of this camera.  I was only interested in getting a waterproof camera so that I could go out in the rain or take it snowboarding and not worry about moisture.  I do not plan to use it underwater on purpose.So far, I have only taken indoor shots in medium light.  It appears that many cameras can take decent outdoor shots due to the better lighting, so my personal test is indoor shots.  Also, I intend to use the camera frequently in party and bar settings, so this becomes even more important.  The Z33 WP claims to have scene-recognition and should be a very automatic camera for beginner users.  With and without a flash, my pictures show excessive image noise.  I thought it might be the typical ISO-boost, so I manually forced the ISO lower.  There is still so much noise when I display the pictures full-size on a computer screen that I am very disappointed.  The videos are smooth and have very impressive sound, but they also appear to be filled with the same image noise.  I will try to post pictures on an update, but I feel bad that I can't produce anything decent to look at.  I'm hoping that it is simply my fault and I will keep trying for now, but a fully automatic point-and-shoot should make the process of taking a clear picture simple, right?  I know that better lighting will help, but this is too poor for my needs.  I am considering exchanging the camera for a different one.  I am considering the Olympus 550WP or one of the Olympus Tough series.  I know that Oly waterproof cameras aren't known for great image quality, but I'm hoping they have to be better than this Fuji.In conclusion, my 5MP Casio P&S; took much, much clearer pictures than this camera and I would be embarrassed to show these indoor pictures I have taken to anyone.  I will be looking for a different camera.

Reviews.Title: Buy for the waterproof/ruggedness, not photo quality
Reviews.Author: S. Carmody
Reviews.Content: Like my title says, I wouldn't buy this for the photo quality.  But for those environments that kill other cameras, this is great. I am a fulltime firefighter, and originally bought this to keep in my bunker gear.  But, it's small enough I actually keep it in my uniform pocket all the time.  We have an expression in our academy - "If you didn't want to get wet, you should have been a librarian."  I figured that my environment would thoroughly test this camera.  Then last night I accidentally left in my pocket and it went through the washer and tumble dry/high heat.  Came through with some flecks of paint transfer from the dryer, but fired right up, no problems.I bought this knowing the picture wouldn't be the best, but figuring it'd at least be functional when others weren't.  The photos were better than I expected; they are a bit grainy if zoomed in upon, but still not as bad as I thought.  I wouldn't put them up against those from my D-SLR, but I darn sure wouldn't take my D-SLR where this baby goes.  Even still I probably would have given this just 4 1/2 stars because of the quality.  I now give this a full 5 stars after putting through the wash; it saw more abuse than it ever would have in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Complete Disappointment
Reviews.Author: P. Wiklanski "reading rider"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a secondary camera to take on vacation to Hawaii, basically I wanted a camera that could withstand the water and beach so I didn't have to risk damage to my main camera and also to take underwater snorkeling.Initially I was impressed with the camera, the ergonomics were good, size was right and the texture of the body seemed like it would be easy to grip wet. I also liked the buttons on the back, large and like a cell-phone touchpad, again, seemed much easier to use in the water. I was not excited to give up a viewfinder but it seems that they are a relic of the past in the point and shoot world; too bad. I liked the camera enough to buy it. I bought it with enough time to try it out before traveling, I'm glad  did.I took the camera on a day trip to the west side of Michigan on a cloudy and sprinkling afternoon. Right away one aspect of the camera began to mildly frustrate me, the shutter release button. The button is very stiff, so much so that I was constantly worried that pressing the button with enough force to actually take the picture would cause the image to be blurry. I suppose it may be good to prevent mistaken images but I found it frustrating. Another issue with the camera is that the lens is covered by glass however the glass is only slightly recessed from the front of the camera meaning that the glass is highly prone to smudges and fingerprints, annoying, much worse that other cameras. While using it I felt like I got the hang of it and didn't panic when a wave came crashing in, soaking me and the camera. I was starting to overlook the shutter button and the lens smudging issues;UntilWhen I got home I loaded the images into Photoshop Elements and right away noticed that the images were quite washed out, not a lot of contrast and exposures were definitely off. No matter, I went to work editing but immediately noticed that the corners of the images were extremely blurry, and quite a bit darker, almost like a circular soft focus filter was in place, not what I was hoping for. I then started to look more closely at the images and it wasn't just the corners that were distorted, objects in the image were surrounded with blue lines! Yes, it was like each object in the image had been traced with a thin neon blue pen! At first I thought this was on just pictures taken in lower light but then realized that it was in all the pictures in varying degrees; this combined with the out of focus corners and poor exposure were only made worse by visible graininess across any image where the zoom was at its full length. Basically, despite some compositions that I really liked, every picture is unsuitable for printing.Sure, if I want to only look at the pictures as thumb nails or very small, definitely not larger than 2"x3" then the images could almost be considered passable, anything larger, say your normal 4"x6" print, yo will be greatly disappointed! Needless to say the camera was boxed up and returned for an exchange, now I've got an Olympus that I'm going to try out and see, my expectations are low, but I'm hoping just the same. I'm just glad I found out now rather than after my vacation.Bottom line is this; this is without a doubt an awful camera. I am shocked that Fuji would actually sell this camera, my first digital point and soot (bought in 2000 with 4 megapixels) takes better pictures than this. Seriously, Fuji should be ashamed, this from a long fan of their film, do not buy this camera!

Reviews.Title: If broke, replaced with used
Reviews.Author: TexAg98 "HZ"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera used it once.  The second time I used it, it had water in the digital screen, I turned it off and turned it on a day later to find a black spot covering the entire screen with several black lines, and unable to see anything else or take pictures.  A note in the box states to not to bring back to store of purchase to call Fuji, which I did.  They directed me to a repair form, which I had to fill out, send back and pay for the shipping and oh they would either repair it or send me a re-furbished one.  My camera was not even a month old, had only been used twice, I paid $179 + tax for it and I could only get a refurbished camera.  The pictures from the first time were ok, but at the risk of spending that much to have it break down so quickly and only get a refurbished camera in return, I would not take again.

Reviews.Title: Not so great...
Reviews.Author: A. Allen
Reviews.Content: I love this little cameras package.  The color, the functionality, it's waterproof (which was the main reason I wanted it) and it's just too darn cute.  However, all that aside, the picture quality is horrible.  I was so disappointed.  I actually returned it because of this fact.  For 10mp it should have had great picture quality.  My Nikon Coolpix 5mp has way better picture quality so I'll stick with it now.  For the Fuji Z33WP though, I could not believe how grainy the pictures were.  I even used multiple settings and megapixels to see if I could be satisfied but it didn't work.  Keep this in mind if you plan on purchasing this camera.

Reviews.Title: I dig this camera!
Reviews.Author: Nettie M. Vierra
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best buys in cameras.  I will not take a big camera on a trip..I just know that about myself but alot of smaller cameras don't take great pictures or they are cumbersome to use.  Not this one!  Takes great pictures and the buttons are really user friendly.  I would recommend this camera to anyone who likes to just be able to slip their camera in their pocket but yet not compromise the quality of the shots AND its waterproof to 13 feet!  How can you beat that?

Reviews.Title: cute small camera but...
Reviews.Author: C. Sabo "plumcrazie528"
Reviews.Content: I did not know when I bought the camera from QVC that you need to replace the waterproof sealing on the camera once a year to maintain the camera's water resistant. You can download the manual on QVC's website or Fuji's. It doesn't tell you this in the booklets you get with the camera. I've called Fuji and they told me its $35.00 to have the sealing on the camera; not including shipping it to the company and back to you. I will be returning this camera this week. I'm very disappointed with Fuji doing this to their customers.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for snorkelers!!
Reviews.Author: Snorkel Gal
Reviews.Content: Saw some snorkelers with these (and similar sized Olympus) waterproof cameras while on vacation in Maui and decided to pick one up on a whim.I managed to find one of these for very close to the Amazon price at a Long's Drugstore in Lahaina.I've not been as happy with a purchase in a long time!  The camera worked absolutely fantastic for my purposes.  I wanted to capture some images of the wonderful underwater residents at Honolua Bay.  I've uploaded a few example shots, but have many dozens of similar quality images.If you are a snorkeler and want to snap some pictures, this is the ticket!

Reviews.Title: Great pocket beach resort/vacation camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Sarah & Randi
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera right before my vacation in Thailand because I wanted a waterproof camera to take snorkeling pictures.  Here are my thoughts:Pros:1. Great value for a 10 mp camera that also works under water (up to 10 meters)2. The float strap that comes with the camera is great (Target sells the camera with the silicon cover and the float strap for $159.99).  We would throw the camera to each other in the water to take pictures and the float strap keeps the camera afloat.3. Pictures turn out nice when lighting is good and when you hold the camera steadily (my Canon PowerShot SD750 takes more consistently crisp pictures)4. The flash was powerful enough to take great underwater picturesCons:1. The zoom is not powerful enough2. Pictures turns out blurry when lighting is not good3. Bad night time pictures with no tripods4. The lense is not covered.  Before taking pictures, you'll need to make sure the lense is clean or you'll see streaks or blurry marks on your pictures5. The camera response is slow between commands/picturesOverall, this is a great waterproof camera for the purpose of taking pictures under water and for places you would not want to get your regular camera dirty (e.g., beach, water park).  This is definitely a great 2nd camera to take with you.  I would not recommend this for your primary camera.*****UPDATE****We took this camera to our Costa Rica vacation and it's great for water sports.  We took it to our waterfall rappelling excursion and it was great!  We were able to take action pictures of each other rappelling off the cliff/waterfalls using our camera while other tourists had to purchase pictures taken by the tour guide. I still stand by the pros and cons I provided in my original review; however, I find myself appreciating this camera more on this vacation.  This is still not my primary camera for the vacation.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Amazing
Reviews.Author: Kaytlin Simons "Camera Crazy"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera. I have gone through 6 cameras in the past 3 years and this is the one. Its waterproof which is perfect because I go on a dozen cruises a year so i wont have to worry about water damage. Its easy to use..lots of different options. You dont have to worry about red eye or anything and it even has a mode where it takes two pictures each time..one with a flash and one without. ITS AMAZING! /I recomend this camera for all ages. =]Fujifilm FinePix Z33WP 10 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Green)

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Sean P. Flynn "WDW Fan in MD"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very much looking forward to using this camera.  The features seemed to be amazing and the previous reviews were mostly excellent, so we were stoked...until it arrived.Our biggest problem with this camera is that it does not take good pictures at all.  We took several photos with it out of the box and every one came out slightly blurry.  The first night we blamed the less than perfect indoor lighting conditions and kept our hopes up.  That didn't last.The following day we took several outside shots with optimal sunlight and still the pictures were not crisp and sharp.  I was a film and photography major in college, so I adjusted several of the manual settings, but we still could not get 1 clear picture.  And to answer the lingering question, yes I did hold down the shutter button until the subject was in focus and I got the ever loving go ahead and take your picture "beep".The video quality was average, but definetely not good enough to keep the camera.  We ultimately sent it back and got the Kodak Easy Share M-1033 which is not an underwater camera, but takes far better pictures.  I guess it is possible that the camera I received may have been defective, but I did not want to risk having to ship back another camera.  I actually hope I did receive a defective one and the rest of you have better luck, but proceed with caution.  I wanted to ignore the other bad review that this camera got, but unfortunately I am in the same boat with her.ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: G. Chen "what is in a nickname"
Reviews.Content: For the current amazon price ($106 USD), this item is a steal! I bought this camera because I wanted to take underwater pictures for a vacation in Hawaii. Since I was experimenting with underwater photography, I did't want to spend too much - just in case, this didn't work out. But it turns out, I had nothing to worry about! I just returned from Hawaii. Most of my trip (1 week long) was spent by the beach or in the water. This camera was so durable and easy to use. I took over 600 pictures (using a separately purchased 8 GB memory card) and the camera battery only needed recharging 1x the whole trip!  All of my friends were awed by the camera and are planning to get one for themselves.I looked at some of the other reviews on here. A small number commented that they did not like the picture quality. I personally find it fanatastic. The picture quality setting can be changed from 10 MB down to much less, as needed. I kept my setting at 10 MB. The pictures when transferred onto my computer looked great and were comparable to other camera pictures of the same type but different brand (Nikkon, Sony, Cannon). (My house owns a lot of cameras.)  The waters in Maui were generally very clear, but even so it was necessary to hold the camera close in order to get good shots under water. I would estimate the camera has a 3 ft visibility range under regular salt water.  Even with this range, I was able to get clear shots as long as I held the camera close to the subject matter. I bet visibility would improve in pool water or truly clear water. (I'm a little jet lagged now so I may upload my pics at a later date.)I also noticed that a few people claimed the camera did not work and broke. I can only comment according to my personal experience. According to the instructions, you have to make sure that the battery slot & memory card slot clicks closed. Just slide the slot until you hear a faint noise. The inside of the camera obviously is not waterproof, just the outside is coated with some material to help keep water out. The casing must be closed tight to prevent water from seaping into the electronics.Also, a few people mentioned the shutter delay. There is a fraction of a second delay, but I find that unless you get a SLR you will probably experience delay in most handheld digital point and shoots. The delay is comparable to other cameras of a similiar type, and in general, I would say somewhat better if not on the same level with most other point and shoots.This is overall a great light weight little camera, especially given the price. If you want to take fun vacation photos and not have to worry too much about theft or water damage, I would buy and have bought this camera.  I LOVE IT! (As you can see from my star rating).

Reviews.Title: Great option for water/beach vacations - forget those throwaway cams
Reviews.Author: G. Esteban
Reviews.Content: I vacation a lot in water/beach locales and love to snorkel in particular.  I've typically purchased the throwaway underwater cameras and have been dissatisfied with the results since I get spotty images and am very limited in picture quantity (usually 24 shots).  Coupled with the fact that I have to get them developed - the costs start to add up since I usually brought about 2-3 of the 24 exposure cameras along.I considered underwater casing as well for my land camera - but thought this a bit pricey for a "case" and unconvinced it would be comfortable using underwater and truly "waterproof".  Didn't feel like finding out the hard way.At a little over $100 - this camera totally pays for itself vs. the throwaway underwater cameras.  I used a 2GB card and took over 500 pictures of the gorgeous reefs and tropical life in Belize.  I'm so pleased with the image quality and ease of taking pictures underwater.  I received the day before we left and didn't even have to read the instruction booklet - it was so easy to use and very intuitive.The screen is great underwater and it worked great after three half-day snorkelling trips (over 1.5 hours underwater each trip).  Battery life is pretty good too -- though I messed around with the flash function the first day and, as expected, this seemed to drain the camera much faster.The camera can be used out of the water as well and takes great pix too as can be expected from a Fuji camera.I considered buying the floatie "kit" -- but decided against it and am glad I declined.  I just used the wrist strap that came with it and it was just fine.  (just make sure the strap is wrapped around your wrist securely of course!)Highly recco this little camera if you want to take pix in or underwater -- on vacay or at the beach/pool without the worries of messing up your land camera.  I'm thrilled with it and believe it was money well-spent just for the memories I captured on this one trip.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera for "wet" vacations.
Reviews.Author: KindlePad
Reviews.Content: This little camera is really quite fun. The 2 most important features are (a) its Waterproof & (b) its very reasonably priced. We were vacationing at a resort this past summer & I knew that quite a lot of time was going to be spent in the wonderful pool complex the resort has. In the past, I could never really take a lot of pics near or in the pool as I didn't want to risk my very expensive Sony camera. I looked at waterproof housings but they are also $$ and seem to have issues with fogging, hard to use, etc..I thought I'd try this little camera, in addition to my Sony & it worked great. I was able to give this camera to the kids who took it on water-slides and zip lines and all sorts of activities and it came thru fine. For the price, I have no complaints.Pros:Its waterproof! How cool is that?!Construction is very sturdy, very small and portable. Fits in your pocket easily.Decent battery life. I did drain it a few times but it was being used a LOT.You can shoot underwater pics & video with sound! Definitely cool to capture the kids playing in and under water. The video is a blast.Comes with a very small, portable, wall-unit type battery charger, not a giant brick. Very convenient.There is an instant video capture button that was quite handy for quick video shooting, very nice!Underwater pics and vids shot in daylight look amazing.My kids were amazed at seeing themselves underwater in pics & vids. Very fun!Cons:Still image quality can't compare to the Canon, Nikon and Sony cameras.There is a fair bit of picture noise and the colors are not the best.Video is 640x480, so sort of low res but really do you expect HD for this price?The flash throw is pretty weak, at night this camera is not at its best.No advanced features to speak of. This is a point and shoot camera.Don't get me wrong, its a very adequate little camera. To the average "joe" the picture quality probably looks fine. I would never want this to be my only camera, but as a waterproof camera whose job is to take pics in the pool, at the beach, etc I could not be more pleased. It sort of proves the rule that the best camera is the one you have with you - and if you have been wanting to take family pics in and under water - this is a great little camera that won't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: Purchased twice and both failed to be water proof after 1 use each.
Reviews.Author: Mechelle Mortenson "Mechelle Mortenson"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera twice from two seperate supliers for a vacation in Hawaii were I didn't want to take my expensive cameras and lenses. I did not expect it to do what my high end cameras do. I did want to be able to take quick easy snap shots and some snorkeling pics. The first camera I bought before leaving and the day after I tested it out snorkeling in sharks coves tidal pools only chest deep it craped out. It would work off and on but would get a purple tinged screen and seeze up after a few shots even when it did choose to work. Now it just gets a white screen and does nothing.I still have to return it. It didn't leak into the battery and card space so those were fine. It just ruined the view finder. I figured it was a freak thing so I went to walmart which I hate but had no other option and bought the same camera again. Used it the next day in Hanuama bay, over my head but only used at serfice level. Got some ok fish shots and some great turtle shots of a friendly and curious guy who had no intention of moving. It was like he was posing! On the way back to our condo we took shots of us together with the timer along the windward coast and they are not bad for a cheap point and shoot. The next day exactly the same thing happened, purple screen worked off and on then seezed up and nothing! It did take grainy green and purpleish shots again once we hit Walmart to return it. Again my card was fine. I have no clue why they broke but I feel twice duped! Please don't buy it for use in water if you need it to be reliable like for a irreplaceable vacation!

Reviews.Title: Lousy photo quality
Reviews.Author: LuckyDan
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this camera. The photo quality is very grainy..even at 10 megapixels. I have an old Cannon 3mp camera that takes a heck of a lot better photos than this.The expected sharpness of typical digital photos just isn't there no matter what setting you use.Even after taking about 50 test shots I just can't believe a digital camera's photo quality could be so bad.If you are looking for a spare camera to take to the beach where you are not too concerned about quality, this one one would be OK I guess. But for an all purpose camera for shooting everyday things, holiday photos or important occasions I'd steer clear of the Fujifilm Finepix Z33WP.

Reviews.Title: poor image quality
Reviews.Author: TenFootMonster
Reviews.Content: I putchased this camera because I wanted a good pocket camera for vacations, and I figured the waterproof thing would be a nice advantage.  The form factor of the camera is good.  It seems well designed, is stylish, and is extremely small.  However, the picture quality is extremely poor.  I tried several shots, both indoors and out, and I was amazed at how poor the picture quality was.  The indoor shots were  just unusable.  The outdoor shots, while better, were still not great.  If image quality matters to you at all, I recommend you buy a different camera.  I returned mine and got a different brand.

Reviews.Title: only lasted 3 days
Reviews.Author: K. Watson
Reviews.Content: Bought one of these brand new for a family vacation to St. John.  Took great above & below water pictures for 3 days then it just died.  Would not turn on.  We've had digital cameras in the family for many years with no similar DOA experiences, so we know how to handle them & don't think it was caused by mis-handling.  NO water got inside the camera.  Thank goodness we had a backup Nikon with us.  Unfortunately we missed pictures of sea turtles and starfish (our favorites) because the Nikon was above water only.  We plan to return this Fuji to the retailer for refund, NOT replacement.  Would not buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for snorkeling and the beach!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "robotoid"
Reviews.Content: This made life so much easier on my trip to Hawaii, where we spent a lot of time on the beach or snorkeling.  It was easy to use in the water, buttons etc.  I recommend buying the floating strap though, as it does not float on it's own.We got much better pictures than we ever have with the disposable underwater cameras, and using a 4gb memory card in it totally allowed us to go nuts and take as many pictures as we wanted.  And battery life was surprisingly good.  I liked the pictures even more when I loaded them onto the computer from the camera.  They look grainier on the little view screen.It's great in and out of water, just remember to wipe off the water from the lens when you leave underwater shooting, or you'll get blurry spots in your out of water photos.  Just common sense, I know.Also, when you use the forced flash underwater, if the water is a little bubbly, you might get some bright dots that look pixelated.  So turning off the flash may help.One thing I did read about a lot that I will confirm.  Low light photos are a little grainy, so if you're going to use this indoors, don't expect it to be a replacement of your regular everyday camera that you love.Overall, I'm extremely pleased with the purchase.  I'll be using this a lot for vacations and beach jaunts.  It was even fun to use in the pool, and great for a day that was a little rainy.  I didn't have to worry about keeping my electronics covered!

Reviews.Title: Optimized for price, compactness and light underwater use
Reviews.Author: J. Wilensky
Reviews.Content: It has limitations as do all compact cameras, and since this one is optimized for light duty underwater and all-weather use and also for compactness and price, it lags in other areas -- indoor, low light, noise in shadow areas, overall operation speed, etc. But it does well what it is supposed to, which is to be a take everywhere underwater capable digicam without the need for expensive underwater housings. One tip -- turn off the slideshow transitions, as even the reviewing of photos uses those transitions if they are turned on. No issues with this camera yet after a few underwater uses. Do get the silicone case, as it makes for a much more grippable camera and offers better protection as well of the lens and screen, in the water or out. [...]

Reviews.Title: Best Camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Ethan Markel "E"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a snorkeling trip in St. Croix.  I looked at every waterproof camera available and narrowed it down to the Cannon D10 and the Fujifilm WP Z33.  However, i quickly realized nothing can compare to this Fujifilm and i will tell you why:First off, the Canon is WAY too big to fit in your pocket, so you could pretty much only use it in the water because you would never carry it around on land.  Also, it is MUCH more expensive than the Fujifilm and these days electronics usually don't last longer than four years anyways so why pay that much?The Fujifilm did an amazing job on my trip.  It took great pictures underwater and on land.  I bought it hoping it could be my all around camera and it is doing a great job!  It has great picture settings and the video quality is excellent for this little camera.  I read some other reviews saying how water got into it but I think people just did not follow the rules.  For starters, do NOT go more than 3 meters under no matter what (don't say "I am sure it can go deeper they are just saying that to be safe.")  Also, make sure you soak it in fresh water for 5 minutes after you use it and wipe it dry afterwards...if you do that then you will be fine.I am very impressed with this camera...the buttons are easy to use underwater and it is lightweight and easy to transport.  The only negative is that the pictures take a little long to switch when you are reviewing them on the camera...but i am just nitpicking here.Ultimately, if you are looking for an underwater camera this is the one to buy.  Its so great you can even use it as your normal everyday camera because then you don't have to worry about spilling water on it!  (That's what I am doing and i love it!)Oh, and for fun you can pretend to accidentally spill water on it in front of your friends and act like its broken, its a fun joke ha ha.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Price!
Reviews.Author: M. Rodriguez "Cnyper"

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_38148091currentClick) { return cv_38148091currentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:08 MinsTo address other reviews:The cable included is not proprietary, it works with my polaroid i733 AND my Canon Powershot S5 IS. However, it is not standard USB on the camera end. I don't know what one would call it - I thought it was proprietary at first, but my wife proved me wrong by using it with ALL our cameras.This camera does not have the best quality, indoors or out. But it has GOOD quality. Just look at customer pictures to get an idea.However, this thing works GREAT as a childproof/outdoor/beach camera. I dropped it and placed it under water. Still works! I bought this camera with a starter kit for 179.99 - it comes with a rubber sleeve which keeps it from scratching. This camera is slick, too. It's very thin and few buttons make it easy to operate. The battery is rechargeable li-ion. The bundle I purchased it with also comes with a flotation device to attach to the camera. So now, when we're at the pool, I just attach the flotation grip and throw it in the water when people want to use it. Then, when they're done, they just throw it back on the deck - doesn't matter if I catch it or not!If you're looking for a camera to take with you on outdoor adventures, birthday parties, or even to disneyworld, this is the best you can get. The low price is just a bonus! if you're looking for something to use for your photography classes, you may want to pass.

Reviews.Title: Excellent price for underwater pics!
Reviews.Author: CK
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo21D8G8G4AA86G', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo21D8G8G4AA86GloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo21D8G8G4AA86GcurrentClick) { return cv_mo21D8G8G4AA86GcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:36 MinsI bought this product for our trip to the Bahamas. The first time we went to the Bahamas, we purchased disposable cameras which were ok but we spent over $50 on 4 cameras and another $40 on developing. Over half of the pictures were blurry and I ended up throwing most of them away. I read the reviews and saw that the quality wasn't great but I thought it would be better than wasting money on disposables again. The pictures were EXCELLENT! only a couple were too blurry to send to print. Shots taken underwater (cloudy & sunny), in the shade, bright sunshine, cloudy...all perfect! The dark shots didn't turn out very well but I didn't have time to look at the settings. The video is neat but at this price, it doesn't include a stablilzer so takes some practice to get a stable video. The clarity is great on the video too! The video attached was taken by my 13 year old!I would recommend this camera for convenience. On previous trips, I would have to carry a large heavy camera bag with my high end Canon Digital camera & different lenses, a bulky digital video camera, underwater disposables and then worry that they would be stolen or ruined. This camera is grab and go! It was so nice to only carry a credit card and 1 camera when we went ashore. I took almost 1000 pictures and videos and had to delete only a handful. I now carry it in my purse so I have it with me all the time!No Complaints for the $95 I paid for this camera!

Reviews.Title: Fabulous low-priced waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: A. Pecorella
Reviews.Content: This is an easy 5-star review to give for the price.  We bought to camera for a trip that included snorkeling, and it was absolutely fantastic.  We got lots of great underwater pics, but we even ended up using it for lots of dry pictures too.  It has a surprising number of cool features for such an inexpensive camera, including face recognition, a ton of scene settings (including wet ones like beach, snow, and underwater), a decent zoom, 640x480 movies, and an impressive boot-up time of about 2 seconds.  We kept finding new little features throughout the trip.  It's not a professional camera at all, but it's a great point-n-shoot.  It's also brilliant for dirty places like a beach, since if you get it sandy or dirty you can just dunk it in water and wash it off.  We used to carefully bring a nicer point-n-shoot to the beach and keep it in a plastic bag the whole time.  Now, we're much more relaxed and less paranoid about dropping the camera, which really is fantastic.  We still use a nicer camera when we want great photos, but for casual shots or vacations this is our goto gadget now.The only downsides we've seen: we occasionally had focus issues in movies and point-n-shoot (though holding halfway before shooting generally fixed this), we once saw some condensation on the inside of the screen (not sure if this is indicative of a problem or can just happen when it gets really hot), and it's only rated to 10 feet deep, so there were a few times when I couldn't dive down with it as far as I wanted without risking compromising the seals.  It also can be a little slow sometimes when going through pictures, though the super-zoomed-out thumbnail view (with probably 50 images visible at a time) is really slick for quickly finding shots in a large bunch.Memory cards are dirt cheap (we got the Kingston 4 GB Class 4 SDHC Flash Memory Card SD4/4GB and it worked great).  I'd also recommend the Fujifilm Z33WP Neoprene Weatherproof Sport Case as a cheap, simple case for the camera.  Doesn't have room for accessories, but will protect in transit and even floats if you drop it in the water.  We were fine on one battery, though we charged it each night after heavy use.  It seemed to drain pretty quickly with video, so it might be worth having a second battery, except that keeping that second battery dry could be a pain (which is why we didn't bother).  In any case, I highly recommend this as a cheap waterproof for casual vacation pictures, or perhaps a high-end camera for kids (who are old enough to be trusted to not open the battery door).  Photophiles might find things wrong with the color or picture quality, but for average users I think it it's perfect.  Plus, the metallic color is purdy.  :)

Reviews.Title: I really like it
Reviews.Author: Juan F. Adamson "Opai"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to take amazing quality pictures, this is not the camera. But if you are looking for saved everyday moments, road trip memories, and some water pics this is the best. Cheap, easy to used and really versatile. You get a nice deal for your money.

Reviews.Title: great outdoor camera!
Reviews.Author: stacy therriault
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for outdoor use because it is waterproof.  My only complaint is the fact that sometimes you have to press pretty hard to get it to take pictures, and if you don't give it time to focus you get a very blurry picture.  Other than that I love it and would recommend it to others!  Love the green!I still haven't figured out all of the features or the software.  I don't know if you can edit pictures with the software like Kodak (previous digital camera).  Not quite as user friendly, but better camera with a better battery life.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for water loving teenager
Reviews.Author: L. Duquette "DukeGrl"
Reviews.Content: The biggest appeal of this camera is its waterproof capabilities. The green color is also very awesome and is as bright in person. This camera was bought for a teenager because of the low price and so that it can be used at the waterpark or could be accidentally left out in the rain (you know how kids can be). It isnt shockproof so clumsy kids beware!Testing the unit lead me to see that the best pictures were taken when outside but indoor pictures were not too bad. The pictures came out better on my computer than the LCD showed. The buttons feel really cool to the touch. The battery door is a little tricky to figure out but it does have to be waterproof. The video function is pretty good and catches good sound.Overall, the camera is a lot of fun for what it is. Just keep in mind that you will need a nicer digital camera (read: non-waterproof and a little more expensive) if you want the best photos to frame on the wall.

Reviews.Title: Poor Indoor/Flash and Low Light Pictures
Reviews.Author: Ohio Grandpa
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the overall design and waterproof feature of this camera.  The outdor pictures I took were acceptable to darn good.  The disappointment came from trying to take a simple snapshot with the flash in Automatic mode.  The results are unusable and the moments are gone. I tried working with Juji support who suggested going to manual mode and changing the ISO setting.  I did not see much improvement and the process is way too complicated for a point and shoot camera.  If you can afford a "beach" camera only this may be a good choice.  If you also need it to take a picture of the Birthday Party - look elsewhere.  I returned the camera.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Stephen J. Leary "sjlsw1"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to Iceland.  I was attracted to the waterproof aspect of this camera.  The camera is small and easy to carry around.  I wanted a camera for sight seeing and didnt want to lug around my slr.  Overall an ok camera.  HOwever, the picture quality is below average compared to other point and shoots i have had in the past.  I wish I spent a little more money and went with the new canon or pentax waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Anna Musiyenko
Reviews.Content: This camera is waterproof. I put it in a bucket of water and left it for hours. No leaking. Love the bright green color, and it will be great for getting all of my water fun on my upcoming cruise! Now I just have to learn how to use it.

Reviews.Title: Takes great underwater photographs, especially macro
Reviews.Author: Thomas Adam L.
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_moQ1SM4T80L28O', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_moQ1SM4T80L28OloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } } } Length:: 0:18 MinsI bought this for my wife who is a very experienced photographer. The original plan was to buy a more expensive model. But we ended up getting this one instead.We are not disappointed at all. I'm on a three year stay in Hawaii for the Army and on our off days we like to go snorkeling. So far it has performed admirably. Underwater shots taken in low light conditions are of mediocre quality but ones taken in full sunlight are superb. Macro shots are my wife's favorite and on a recent trip to Shark's Cove she was amazed by the quality this camera returned.The video is of that trip.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - survived 7 weeks in 25'water
Reviews.Author: Tracy "Tracy"
Reviews.Content: I've had the Z33WP since 2008 or 2009.  I have always loved the quality of photos taken with it.  I don't use it inside so I can only speak to outside photos.  I've found the color saturation to be great.  I carry this camera when I am Kayaking, usually ocean kayaking.  In August 2012 I dropped it in the ocean while kayaking in Alaska.  The camera was found recently in 25'of water after 7.  The camera is still in perfect working order and the SD card was in perfect condition.  I wouldn't hesitate to purchase another one of these cameras, in fact I will probably buy one for a fellow kayaker as a Christmas gift.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!!!! :)
Reviews.Author: Ryann Huff
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for something inexpensive, easy to use, small and compact, and because it is waterproof. I am a camera/photography enthusiast, and I own many different cameras. I have to say that my husband and I were pleasantly surprised with this camera. We love the outdoors and spend most every weekend camping, swimming, kayaking, etc... We have taken this camera with us in the woods, in the water, and out on the town. It NEVER disappoints. Picture quality is great, colors are excellent, ease of use is awesome! My grandma could figure it out. Our favorite feature is the underwater video feature. We have had so much fun recording ourselves, friends, family, and pets swimming under water. Our kids even take the camera in the pool and record themselves goofing off, jumping in, etc... And the camera is durable (which is why we let the kids use it :) The only thing I could say as far as a "down side" is the battery loses some of its charge in really cold water (68 degrees), BUT the battery WILL recharge itself if you keep it out of the cold for a few minutes. At any rate, all around I give this camera a 10!!!! I literally have thousands of dollars worth of photography equipment and this little camera is my favorite grab and go. GREAT BUY!!! For the price... YOU WILL BE SUPER HAPPY :) (unless of course you're just a grumpy person and like to complain about stuff)

Reviews.Title: TAPE THE DOORS SHUT!!!
Reviews.Author: A. Murray
Reviews.Content: Do NOT "wait and see." Do NOT "Try it out first." Do NOT think "This guy is incompetent, it won't happen to me." Do NOT take this camera under water until you have used electrical tape to securely lock the door to the battery/memory card.I bought this before going on the vacation of a lifetime and it lasted TWO trips into the water before the "lock" opened when either my finger moved it while swimming or it just unlocked with the waves. Either way, I never saw a picture from it except through the view screen. It is an excellent idea IF you actually waterproof it yourself.

Reviews.Title: Perfect waterproof cheap portable camera for vacation
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: I bought this little camera with very low expectations; basically I wanted something to take on vacation that was a step up from a disposable underwater camera.  Turns out this is a great all around outdoor camera for the price that is small enough to fit into any pocket!  I say outdoor because as some reviews state, low-light indoor shots are a little grainy but what do you expect for a super-compact, small-lens, built-in flash camera for just over a hundred bucks.  This camera made it through 2 weeks of saltwater/kayak/hot-tub/suntan lotion/sand abuse and never missed a shot.  What really surprised me was the quality of the underwater videos when snorkeling and playing around in the hotel pool.  For low-light indoor photos I used one of my other cameras but would recommend this to anyone looking for a go-anywhere, water proof camera that is inexpensive (and sturdy) enough to let the kids run around with it.  Outdoor and good-light shots are on-par with cameras that cost three times as much.

Reviews.Title: CAMERA IS NOT WATERPROOF
Reviews.Author: Pam Ubbelohde
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my husband for a trip to Hawaii as he loves to scuba dive.  He used it 2 times and now the camera does not work!

Reviews.Title: Stylish camera, easy to use, and versatile
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Yeh
Reviews.Content: I got this camera a year and half ago. I got it on a cruise for around $209 but I also got the accessory package with it and also a 1G memory card. I think I got a decent deal. I was in need of a camera so it was a good deal at the time especially because I wanted to take some pictures while we were snorkeling I didn't get the Olympus because it didn't take the standard SD card and I liked the cute PINK color of the Fuji.The salesman explained to me that there were two things to be cautious of. And after reading the review from other people I think it is important warn people who are purchasing this camera of these things. The camera is designed to be water and weather resistant, etc. But some of the reviews mentioned that water got into the camera and it is probably because the user did not secure the hinge on the battery/memory compartment. The salesman emphasized over and over again that if the lock button isn't on there is a possibility water can get inside and then you damage the camera. There isn't anything wrong with the camera, it is actually user error. Not a defective product. Also, some other people mentioned that that buttons were wearing. Again, the salesman emphasized that you have to rinse off the camera after using it underwater especially in chlorine pools or salt water. This makes sense because both chlorine and salt water are extremely corrosive! ***Lock the battery compartment and rinse your camera EVERY USE!*** (I'm certain the user manuals mention this but who really reads them?!?)With that being said, I have been doing those two exact things and have no problem with the camera. I love the camera!!!! It is so easy to use. Just point and shoot type of thing. Not complicated at all. Buttons on the display are easy to use.Also, I am really happy I got the accessory package. It definitely has helped me protect the camera. The package also comes with a nifty flotation device so if you are swimming with your camera and you happen to drop it - it won't sink to the bottom. I highly recommend getting it. It has been a lifesaver.Well, I was so pleasantly surprised with the pictures while snorkeling. Everyone in my family asked me for the pictures later. They kept telling me to bring the camera every time we went for our outdoor excursions because they were too worried about damaging their own cameras! My dad thought I wasted my money until he saw the pictures. (That Christmas I got him the same camera in blue!)Later, I took my new camera to Hawaii and now really enjoy looking at videos of me and my bf snorkeling with sea turtles! This beats any old school underwater camera I have used before. The microphone on the camera is decent too. You can even hear the bubbles in the background in all the underwater vids which is neat. He really wasn't convinced that the camera was any good. He has a Cannon and loves it. But his is not underwater so once he realized how fun it was to take videos of the coral reef with the Fuji he was hooked and begging to hold the camera. (I find his Cannon too complicated for me to be honest! I prefer the easy use of the Fuji. I know I am biased but I do love this camera!!!)So there are a few cons to this camera. The camera cord is not standard which other users mentioned. This I agree is a little annoying as I am the type of person who often misplaces cords like that. So to make up for this the camera takes a standard SD card so I just use an SD reader. Problem solved there. Also, the battery life could be better. The video mode drains the battery quickly. So one thing I always have to remind myself whenever I am about to go on a special event to charge the battery right before we go. Someone also mentioned that they didn't like how you could only charge the battery by taking out and not with a cord. To explain this, I think because it is a waterproof camera and to make it waterproof the exterior and interior have to be more simplified so that there are no extra gears and divots, etc where water could get into potentially. Lastly, the picture quality isn't the greatest at night (great during perfect lighting conditions) and sometimes the camera is slow. For these issues I was able to resolve them by adjusting how I take the pictures. I often suppress the flash so that it doesn't wash out the pictures and I try to anticipate the pictures. But these are all minor qualms compared to how much fun and use I have gotten out of the camera. Plus, it's so affordable! It's a good deal for the money spent. I have recommended this camera to numerous people who have been camera shopping. I would def upgrade to the new model if my dies but so far so good not one issue! '

Reviews.Title: Perfect Camera for the Water
Reviews.Author: Scuba Paris
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_moJHTGUM25PCVT', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_moJHTGUM25PCVTloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } } } Length:: 0:38 MinsThe video says it all. Sorry about the thumb. The video came out 100% perfect but did not transfer over well to Amazon.I took this camera to Six flags and went into the water and down the slides with the camera all day long. Worked Great!Went to the beach and also performed 100%. Camera is small enough to fit into a pocket and comes with a wrist strap that I used in the water. Very easy to set up and install battery and card. easy transfer to computer to download photos.The camera does come with a quick set up guide which is really all that is needed. Purchased from Adorama. Quick shipping!Have Fun in the Sun!!!

Reviews.Title: Good WP Digital for the money!
Reviews.Author: Old Man "JDP"
Reviews.Content: Purchased camera for cruise to Mexico to use for snorkeling.  Ended up using it for kayaking and some shots where I just didn't want to take my Nikon DSLR.  Worked great for snorkeling once I got the hang of it.  It is a little hard to use in bright sunlight as the screen fades out quickly.  Took several snaps and several videos while snorkeling and they mostly turned out great (ones that didn't were usually operator error).  Overall, a very good camera for the money if you are concerned about getting your regular camera wet.

Reviews.Title: I love it! - Great for the beach!
Reviews.Author: Cyril Slater
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  If you're looking for something you can take to the beach, on a cruise, or other places there will be water around, this is a deal.  Allows you to get some great shots you wouldn't normally be able to get.I found the interface to be pretty easy to figure out.  Very similar to other digital cameras I have used and almost exactly like another Fuji camera that I own.Colors are bright and vibrant!  I have gotten some very nice photos with this that look as good as anything else I've done with other cameras.  I'm not a professional by any means but my stuff has looked pretty good thanks to this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Wheels
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a value priced waterproof camera to use while vacationing in Hawaii. We are so pleased with this camera. We used the camera for hours at a time, snapping many pictures.  Our images were good quality and had no problems with battery life or water leaking. We were careful to rinse the camera after each use in the ocean (salt water) as the manual directs. I would recommend this camera for casual, recreational use.

Reviews.Title: TURTLE PICTURES
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a trip to Hawaii to take snorkeling pictures. This is not intended to be a professional camera. It was easy to use. I used Windows Photo Gallery to view and enhance the pictures. This was on my computer already. The water was clear and the sun was shining and the pictures came out great. I got great turtle pictures! Above water the pictures were good also. I was able to take about 50 pictures with a 128MB memory card I had. I also took a short video of swimming turtles! The fish were harder to capture as they do not stay still. Not sure if there is a sport mode on the camera.  Advice: I taped the battery compartment with electrical tape before every use and had no water in the camera. Read the directions. Do not open the camera at the beach. Make sure the battery is fully charged.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm won't back their products
Reviews.Author: Kevin T. Duane "KDuane"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera just for fun. The idea was to have something to take snapshots etc. The waterproof feature was a bonus but this camera never made it into the pool. After about 6 months the LCD just quit. Turn the camera on and nothing. So, as some on here have mentioned, you fill out forms, pay postage, and wait....and wait....and wait. Finally, 3 weeks later I recieved an email that my camera had been recieved and that I would be notifiied of their decision to repair or replace with a referbished camera in 10 business days. Well, then I waited...and waited...and waited again. Today, I recieved a repair estimate for $85.52! That's right, they want me to pay for their camera again! The estimate states that the LCD is cracked and that the body has "minor wear". Not that it will make any difference, but I have pictures of the camera, from every angle, taken the day I packet it off to them. There was not a scratch on the camera as it had been in a protective case since the day I got it. Even better, the LCD is not cracked in my pictures!Bottom line here folks; spend the extra $50 bucks and buy a Nikon or a Canon. Its a small price to pay to not have the stress of knowing you've been flim-flammed! Fuji not only builds junk, they feel he need to shirk their warranty responsibility too!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Pool/Beach Vacations!
Reviews.Author: OCwahine810
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera right before my first ever Hawaiian (Maui) vacation. I was initially looking into a waterproof cover for my Powershot SD1000, but realized that the case would cost more then the camera is probably worth (2 years after I originally bought it.)So after searching for low-cost waterproof digital cameras, I came upon this. Reading reviews here and on cnet.com, I felt it would be worth my money for at least my underwater pictures and video.I took this into the pool a week before my vacation to ensure it'd survive the water. I was surprised at how clear and crisp the pictures came out! The video has an awesome sound feature (although I'm not sure it does much underwater since all you hear is gurgling. It's a great effect though!)Now the ultimate test- Maui! The camera is a bit slow (to turn on, zoom, delete/view pictures) and the functions take a little getting used to, but it takes clear pictures on land and water. I don't know how great the quality is on film or enlarged yet, but on my computer they look just as good as my other camera!The zoom is a bit weak and isn't very clear at the closest zoom (3x). This was not a problem while snorkeling, however- as we're close enough to get clear shots of each other and of the fish!Overall, this is a REALLY fun camera! We enjoyed taking tons of pictures under water and in the waves. For me, pictures are incredibly important and most of my favorite pictures from this trip are from this camera. I HIGHLY recommend this camera!!**Remember to wipe the sand/water spots before taking pictures!****SUPER waterproof! Did not have any leakage problems nor did I even feel paranoid about it. It feels sturdy!****Average battery life - Using this all day (Snorkeling, in the pool, etc.) and it did not die- although I charged every night to make sure I was covered.****MUCH more fun/cost efficient then a disposable waterproof. Being able to instantly see my pictures, take video, have more space- makes a HUGE difference!**

Reviews.Title: Perfect secondary camera for wet conditions
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to take on vacation where I knew I would want a camera that could get wet.  I was happy with this camera, it was definitely water proof (we hiked in the rainforest and swam in a waterfall with it as well as basic beach use).  We had no problems with the camera really, except the battery did ware out (although we took about 200 pictures before the battery died).  The cameras pictures come out clear enough (although I am used to 12+ mega pixels so they did not look as sharp as I am used to).  The camera does take a little longer then higher quality cameras to take a photo, and the shutter speed is not quick enough to take pictures while on the move (for instance while driving above 10MPH) but it does take a nice picture.  I would recommend for anyone looking for a camera to take to the beach/pool, and to use as a secondary camera for those wet conditions.  I would not recommend this camera to be your only camera unless you need the water proof and cannot afford something at a higher price point.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Irissiri
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for the family Hawaii trip. Since we have two digi cameras already, all we need is a waterproof one. I was looking at some covers for regular camera first, but they cost like at least $30, and they don't look that attractive. After reading reviews, we ordered this nicely priced camera. It looked just like a normal camera, I confirmed it's a underwater one with it's instruction manual first before I dip it into the water. The pictures turned out great, not every single one of course, but we did catch many amazing pictures wither snorkeling or in the pool. The camera definitely added a lot of fun for snorkeling. It's very easy to use and the quality for regular pictures are pretty good too. There is a little delay though between you press the button and the picture shows up, but I know a lot of cameras have this issue. You just need to get used to it. Overall, it's a very nice camera for the price you pay. I am very happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: Best Investment Ever!
Reviews.Author: J. Balken ""traveler""
Reviews.Content: I don't know why some complained about the battery life because i went two days straight on my cruise using this camera at eh beach, snorkling, sitting around the pool, and used it at night and it barely was on half of a battery after that. I used it everyday of my cruise in all situations and this camera was excellent in any condition. It took GREAT underwater photos, never leaked, and was easy to operate underwater. We brought our $300 Canon with also, and never ended up using it at all because this camera took great pics on land and the ship as well. It has really easy modes for those who don't understand cameras for instance it has and Underwater mode, a Beach mode, a Night mode, Landscape, and even a Party mode. This was a great camera and super cheap for what it does!

Reviews.Title: Had it for 5 days
Reviews.Author: Nicholas E. Billock "Nick B"
Reviews.Content: I am a long distance trail runner and very often carry my Canon 8MP Digital ELPH camera with me.  Unfortunately, with sweat and rain, I can't always take my camera to capture the gorgeous scenery, wildlife, etc. that I encounter on the trails.  My wife purchased this camera for me for Christmas because it was affordable, rated well at the local big box electronic retailer, and waterproof.Please keep in mind that I am comparing it to nearly any current Canon product as I have been and am still using Canon, for years now.10MP?: you'd never know it.  On the LCD, it looks extremely grainy.  For an average size of 4 megabytes, you'd like crisp and clear...and it wasn't.  When loaded onto the computer for editing, it was average at best with no cropping or enhancement.  Any brightening would greatly distort picture and any zooming made the pic look absolutely horrible with pixels everywhere.Battery Life: within TEN pictures on the initial use, the red battery indicator came on.  Keep in mind that I fully charged the battery before initial use as directed.  To put this in comparison, my SD1100 by Canon lasted through 200 pictures and a 5 hour trail marathon in November without even warning me of a low battery.  200 pictures!  That's a lot of turning on and turning off...thus lots of mechanical motion by the camera without dying.  Unacceptable, FUJI!!!Moving people/objects: often, I take pictures of fellow runners while they are...running!  I tried this and they were all blurry.  I quickly realized I couldn't be moving (like I could with the Canon) but even when I froze and tried to capture fellow runners on the run, they were blurry.  The ability for my Canon to capture moving objects or even things like waterfalls is far superior to the FUJI.Delay between pictures:  Again, with Canon it is very quick.  With this camera, there is a long delay between pictures.  Enough said.Powering on the camera: In the winter, I wear gloves.  The super tiny, recessed power button on this FUJI is nearly impossible to push with anything but a pointy finger.  Very frustrating especially when you consider the delay in powering up.  Bad when I see something I want to capture (like wildlife) and I only have moments to do so before they run off.All in all, I am now without a waterproof camera because this FUJI went back very quickly.  There is simply no comparison with Canon.  I recommend any of the ELPH cameras.  They basically have the same features/technology.  Pick any one of them from 8MP to 12MP and I think you'll be very happy.  For me, I just need to avoid the moisture on my runs!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Baby Help
Reviews.Content: After debating between the purchase of a couple of disposable waterproof cameras and this one, I opted to purchase this camera and am very glad that I did . Although I expected to use it only around the pool and beach, it ended up being one of our primary cameras for the trip.
