We shot all our pics in broad daylight so don't have much info on the night situation . However, it was so easy to use in the pool and the beach. While in the water, I had it roped around my neck and we could take some fantastic pics which we couldn't have if we didn't have a waterproof camera. The underwater videos we took was excellent and I loved the fact that the video can be taken by just pressing a button. No modes to change etc.A lovely camera.

Reviews.Title: Really nice little camera
Reviews.Author: J. Crouch
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my girl and she loves it,I do as well,we took it out in our small(wet) boat with our dogs it got soaked she took 150 pictures(with SD card)and they came out great.Nice camera for the price,lots of fun without worry from the elements

Reviews.Title: Amazing Pictures
Reviews.Author: Shannon L. Bowman
Reviews.Content: What an amazing camera! It takes the most breathtaking underwater shots- the clearest most true to color shots i have ever seen come from an underwater camera. Its lightweight and durable and the battery cahrger is extremely convienet. I would reccomend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Won't replace your daily camera
Reviews.Author: E. A. Montgomery
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to do a technical detailed review here - others have done that well already. My focus is on ease of use. This camera is really fantastic at the task it's advertised for - taking shots while snorkeling, in the pool, at the beach, all came out great.The kids enjoyed using it and it gave us some clips and photos we couldn't put in our year end movie any other way. The colors are great, very strong and vibrant like Fuji film used to deliver. Where the camera falls down is as an indoor everyday unit. My Nikon Coolpix L14 takes much better pictures indoors or in lowlight. The Z33WP gave us grainy, blurred photos with odd texturing. Waiting for the autofocus improved them, but not to the level of my L14 (or an SLR). However, I wouldn't take any of those to the beach or in the pool. (And really, I had no idea how amusing photos of kids blowing air out of their nose could be)  The outdoor shots in full and fading sun were also clean. I got the silicone case because I was concerned about sand. It fit easily and didn't interfere with button use at all.  Overall, really performs for the money. Definitely has a permanent place in the dive bag.Edited 9/2012 - My beloved Z33WP died on a trip to Hawaii after countless trips to waterparks and reefs. Don't know if it was using it too many hours in a row or if it's time had just come, but it made a popping noise before it stopped working. After checking the reviews of more recent models I think I'm going to buy a refurbished replacement of the same model.

Reviews.Title: Great for beach/pool snapshots.
Reviews.Author: jedimom
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to the beach because I did not want to bring my Nikon D90 in the sand and surf.  The photo quality does not compare to the D90 but I did not expect it to.  It provided me with fun snapshots at the beach without the worry.  It is a great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Don't let it sit in the sun!
Reviews.Author: Milena Maurer "milly"
Reviews.Content: This is the second unit that developped water under the LCD screen. It happened both times when the wet camera was sitting in the sun (and not while in the water. It held up great there!).Other than that, we really liked the camera, it is great to have it in the water, and my kids really got into taking pictures with it.I will be returning it, but without replacing it. We have other cameras that take much better pictures than this one. The main attraction was the (now not trustworthy) waterproof feature.

Reviews.Title: VERY Poor Quality Photos
Reviews.Author: Jenna S
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera this morning on a whim.  I had researched a few other cameras, but when I saw this one, I loved the size & color and especially that it was waterproof!  While charging the battery, I read several of the reviews here and thought that I could deal with it not taking top-quality pics, in exchange for the waterproof feature as well as it's compact size.  But after I took several pics, all of my excitement was gone, and I immediately put it back in the box & returned it to the store this evening.  I took pictures both inside & outside, up close & far away (the zoom is minimal at best), and they were just awful.  No other way to describe it.  I use my camera mainly to take pics of my 2 year old daughter, and there is no way that I would miss out on preserving these memories by wasting the pics (and money) on this camera.  I generally do not write reviews or return merchandise, but this one gets a big thumbs down from me!  I will continue to use my 10 year old Kodak for now.  If you want a camera just for looks and not performance, well then this may be for you...Otherwise, keep shopping!

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Nicole @ Paperback Princess
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I got it 4 years ago and it works just as great as it did when I got it. I took it with me on a trip to the Bahama's and my niece constantly plays with it in our pool. The only down side is that it doesn't work as well indoors, but I don't use it inside since it's an underwater camera. I love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Decent, inexpensive underwater camera for fun trips
Reviews.Author: Susan "Susan"
Reviews.Content: A friend and I each purchased this camera earlier this month for a cruise vacation. I hesitated to buy it because it was an older model, but it had the best combination of price and good reviews; there was a far less expensive one but it was a no-name brand with too many bad reviews for my liking.  I found the picture quality comparable to that of my Nikkon Cool Pix and a similar Cannon camera I own, despite the lower number of megapixels of this camera (10 MP compared to 11 MP of the Cool Pix, and 14 of the Nikkon). Both cameras held up under water several times. The quality of the underwater pictures were very good, I did not get to use it for snorkeling as much as I'd hoped, as water conditions weren't the best, so I can't vouch for how it photographs colors of fish, etc., but the underwater pictures came out as clear as it looked when I was viewing the water through a mask. As I'd forgotten my regular camera, this was my main camera for the trip and it took great pictures out of the water, as well. I was surprised to find it was easy to adjust settings such as ISO manually to get better pictures at some outdoor nighttime shows. I never even rinsed it with fresh water as directed and the camera still works fine. Only 1 or 2 pictures had water drops on them from failing to dry it before taking a picture outside of the water. Oops.My one and only complaint is that somehow there is now a small crack/hole on the corner of the battery compartment...probably my fault as I dropped it once or twice....obviously this renders it no longer waterproof, although still usable. Also, the wrist strap is incredibly difficult to attach, I helped my friend with hers but lacked the patience required to attach mine, so I'm lucky it didn't fall down a waterfall or sink to the bottom of the ocean.I should note, another friend on the trip bought a slightly more expensive waterproof camera of a different brand...hers went kaput the second it hit the water...we had TWO of these that made it through the whole trip...albeit one no longer waterproof...

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice
Reviews.Author: Beth B Mcneal
Reviews.Content: This little camera is awesome. It is compact and works great in all environments. It works very well underwater. Pictures are crystal clear!

Reviews.Title: going strong since 2009
Reviews.Author: Ellis Others
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in July of 2009. I have had many, many uses out of it from canoeing trips, to the pool, to the beach, waterslides, skiing, etc. I send my camera into Fuji every year for an inspection (which is free), and so far (knock on wood) I haven't had any problems. This camera takes great outdoor and underwater photos/videos. I would highly recommend this for the outdoorsy person, but if you are looking for a camera to take primarily indoor and people photos, I'd go with something else.I have three complaints about this camera. The first is that the shutter button seems to be difficult for people to use. Every time I ask someone to take a photo, they can't seem to do it. "which button is it?", "do I hold it in?", "It's  not working". ANNOYING. I usually have to ask other people in the group to email me their group/people photos. Which leads me to my second complaint... it doesn't take good photos of people unless you are outdoors with great lighting (on "auto" mode). Yes, this camera does have many features that you can change to accommodate to lighting situations, but in real life unless you're a photographer who has time for that? And my third complaint is the lack of zoom, which is a trade off for having a waterproof camera. I took this camera to my brother's football game and all of the players looked like ants.I gave this camera four stars, because even after my complaints, it fits my lifestyle better than any other camera currently on the market in my price range, and it has lasted a lot of abuse. All of my friends rave about my camera, and two of them have bought it after using mine. My nieces and nephews love to play with it in the pool (the camera is durable enough I don't have to worry about the little ones potentially hurting/breaking it). My camera came with an adjustable "life jacket" that attaches to the camera and then slides on your arm/wrist. A friend's camera came with a silicon case, but not a life jacket. I'd recommend buying both.The reason I was on Amazon today was to browse for a new camera since mine is getting a little old, but after reading reviews, I will stick with what I have. I have included some pictures taken with my camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Jessica Potter
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for underwater use while snorkeling. It takes quality pictures (especially compared to those disposable ones) and has the digital camera bonus of being able to delete the bad ones. I've also used it for above-water photos when we're sailing or kayaking. The picture quality is not as good as my dry-land point & shoot digital, but not so bad that I'd complain about it. Battery life seems to be very good, although I really don't use it a ton. It's small and compact and comes with a wrist strap, although I wish the strap had an adjustable loop closure so I didn't feel like I needed to hold on to it the whole time. I just lost this camera on a trip to Mexico and will most likely replace it with the same one.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof at all!!
Reviews.Author: Kristin McCrone
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my vacation to Mexico.  At first it worked perfectly and the pictures turned out well.  This camera was only submerged in the water once for about 2 mins on day 4 of our trip.  I followed all instructions on cleaning it after being in salt water, but it failed to turn back on later that same day.  I took the batteries out and replaced them with fresh batteries, still no luck.  The pictures I took with the camera were still fine in the sim card, and nothing appeared wet or damaged, just no power.  Very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but Handle Carefully!
Reviews.Author: Mintyfresh319
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this camera SO much! Unfortunately I'm a bit clumsy and dropped it on pavement. Not noticing a small chip in the plastic, I took it diving and water leaked in. Bye bye camera. :-( You'll love this camera, just be careful not to drop it!

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Diane L. Gore
Reviews.Content: This camera is just what I wanted, durable and waterproof.  I take my camera on the boat all summer and my last one got ruined from the moisture just being in my beach bag.  I've used this one for a couple years now and have had no problems.  Wish it took a little better pictures, but for the price it works great!

Reviews.Title: Great heavy duty cam
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Hage "Snowman"
Reviews.Content: I have this camera for more than a year. I used it pretty much everywhere and most of the times far above manufacturer's recommendations. I went far below 20 feet of water, installed it on top of my helmet while snowmobiling using a Kodak mount, at temperatures far below zero, I even mounted it on top of my Siberian husky in stormy blizzards and it's still in top condition. I throw it about everywhere and still not even a single scratch on the lens or LCD screen. Too bad I saw many negative ratings but maybe I was lucky with my cam. The only drawback which seems to perfectly normal is that the battery dies very quickly in cold weather. The pictures are good and underwater pics are excellent. The video is not an HD but of acceptable quality. I'd be pleased to recommend it for outdoor enthusiasts and I'd like to see one with HD and built in GPS soon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Dont have to worry about rain.
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: Took the camera to Costa Rica during the rain season in the rain forest. Went on night hikes and day hikes during the rain and i really liked how I was able to just take it out and use it. Dont have to worry about rain getting on it. Great! Also, I was nervous about doing an underwater shot bc of past reviews but it was fine. 2ft under water with no problems. I got a silicone case for it and that helps protect it even more. Fits in my pocket. I use this camera only if the weather is bad.

Reviews.Title: Best investment for our vacations!
Reviews.Author: Cookie2709
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  I have several digital cameras, including a SLR camera, and this one I really appreciate it a lot!The picture quality is pretty good, I just use it when we are at the beach or pool.  I use it with a long strap that can be worn around the neck, it doesn't bother me to swim or float.It has a pretty good image zoom, enough for playing around with kids.  Easy to use under water and it takes the pictures very fast, much better than my non-waterproof cannon or sony.This is an excellent choice to be used as a secondary camera just for water fun.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY THIS CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: pab931
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my husband in December of 2009.  It worked great until he took in in our swimming pool and an oily substance came out of the camera and it stopped working.  That was a 6 month span.  I called customer service and mailed it back to the company. In a month they sent me a letter stating the camera had an oily substance and it wasn't covered under the guarantee due to abuse!  I called customer service and argued, for an hour, telling them the camera was not used in any other way then unter the guarantee.  A supervisor finally agreed and sent me another camera, a month later. Yesterday, my husband used this camera for the first time under water to photograph some fish at maybe one foot.  The camera had an oily substance come out of it and today it doesn't work.  That's two cameras in 16 months. This time I'll throw it in the trash instead of calling customer service!!!!

Reviews.Title: Fuji Z33WP 'Underwater' Camera
Reviews.Author: Joe Chicago
Reviews.Content: The Z33WP is billed as an underwater camera.  Don't believe it.  Had trouble during first try at 2-foot depth; but thought that perhaps I improperly closed the door.  Dried camera out and seemed to be okay after testing in a sink.  Second try underwater (snorkel depth) deep-sixed the camera.  It no longer works.

Reviews.Title: Wow, a great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was given this camera as a gift to have in my fly fishing vest. I took it out once last year and enjoyed the size and some of the pictures I took with it. Took it out last week on a cruise and was sold on it even more after using it for the entire trip. Shore excursions were amazing with it in and out of the water. Our snorkel guide borrowed the camera and used if for an hour and took some amazing pictures and video and just started to use it with no instructions to run the video. I have also like the other features like natural light and the text and online auction photos. This is a great camera for the features it offers in a small package that can fit in a pocket and not worry about getting it wet when you go snorkeling or just out fishing. I can't wait to mount it to my float tube this summer and get video going through some white water.

Reviews.Title: Impressive Underwater Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: K. ElKammar
Reviews.Content: I mainly purchased this camera because I do a lot of water activities and did not want to worry with my real cameras.  I purchased this camera in April 2010 for a whitewater rafting trip that never happened. . . .  Well I just got back from Jamaica this February 2011, and let me tell you, it is a wonderful underwater camera.  Pictures and videos came out great.  I took pictures in the pool without worry, took video while on the Hobie Kate (sailing) and dropped it a few times.  Conintued to worked like a charm.  I would come back to my room hook it up to the TV to reveiw the footage and I almost cried. Memories I couldn't get without it being waterproof.  Literally water splashing in my face and I'm getting a good clear video.  (Remember to wipe the water from the lens.)  I initially was going for the Canon D10 for $250 but took a chance on this one at $120.  The still pictures and video are okay, but I bought it for its underwater capabilities.  I use my Canons for my great quality photographs.  Just make sure you secure the door to the battery and rinse it off after the ocean.  I now am thinking of updating to the Fujifilm XP10 with the 5 optical zoom.  My only problem with this camera, is the microphone is on the top left and as you hold the camera you might cover the microphone up and miss some audio.And don't even worry about the sand.(No more lens error messages). I believe everyone needs an underwater camera.  Also get a floating wrist strap.  Truly worry free. I would recommend the Fujifilm Z33WP.P.S.  I am trying to upload my Hobie Kat video (@7 minutes), but it's taking along time.  It might be too big.  When I figure out how to shorten it I will upload it.Every traveler needs a water proof, shock proof camera and this fits the build.

Reviews.Title: Nothing But Love... almost
Reviews.Author: megrat7
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend gave me this camera as a birthday present 1.5yrs ago. Overall I love it and have had no problems! I'm an amateur photographer, a hobby really.. and to take good shots of nature, etc it works brilliantly. I've taken it on several trips, including those involving water. I've submersed it in water with no problems and even got some cool shots! Yes, this is much better as an outdoor camera, but the fact that its easy to use trumps the fact that maybe your family holiday pics may have some noise in them. And still I have taken hundreds of pictures and find myself happy with a majority of them. I would deff recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Ok camera for the price but major lag underwater
Reviews.Author: Thompson "T"
Reviews.Content: Really I would give it 3.5 stars. I bought this camera to play around with when I go to the pool, and I will say that yes...it is a nice camera for the price. I have many pictures that have turned out great from using the camera underwater. What I don't like about it is the major lag it has when you press the shutter. It may not seem like a big deal, but when you are underwater it is. Also, this camera is not good for taking pictures in low light; I noticed the colors become strange and look pixelated. Personally, I only use this for underwater photography, but it takes pretty nice pictures outdoors as well. Mine has had some wear and tear and has held up fine, and I've noticed no leaking when I use it underwater. The size is great and is easy to hold. Overall a decent camera for the price, just really bad lag.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: John Alberti "John"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a vacation to Honduras. We planed a lot of water sports and trips in the rain forest. Well it rained a lot. The camera was great. When the sun came out we were in the water. The camera was great. I took over 300 pics. They look very nice. I was going to spend more money on a camera but thought it would get wrecked on this vacation. This little camera was the hit of our trip. Everyone loved it. I just wish the zoom was stronger than 3x but for the money I'm very happy. can't wait to snorkel again and take more pics.

Reviews.Title: JUNK! If I can't use it a 2nd time it's JUNK!
Reviews.Author: DCSurvivalist
Reviews.Content: I bought it and use it after about 2 weeks for a trip to florida. I used it 2 times once out of water and the 2nd to snorkel in about 6ft of water. The next day it's screen showed condensation on the inside. Then its screen went all crazy and was not viewable. I was not able to use it again. I am out of the 15 day return period, but I am lucky a bought a 3rd party warranty from square trade. This a junk! I will never plan on using it in water again which defeats the reason why I bought it! I am very disappointed!2 years later I finally contacted square trade and they had it logged that I had previously contacted them and the unit was covered on the factory warranty so I had to go through the factory to get it fixed (which it was never usable again) The 3rd time I cantacted them they have agreed to give me back the full value of the purchase price. (3 yrs later I have spent money on shipping 3x for this camera and loose out on the taxes I paid for it, Square trade I hope is gonna pull through for me and give me my money back. we'll see!

Reviews.Title: worst service
Reviews.Author: PCF
Reviews.Content: I sent my Z33wp in to be serviced under warranty.  Received with a no problem found...that would be okay if it had no problem.  Did not use again until I was on vacation, and when I went to take my first picture I found the problem once again.Got back from vacation and sent back to Fuji Service and they told me it would be $90.00 to fix the problem.  I called and explained when it was sent back under warranty the problem was not solved so it should be covered under warranty.  They would not wave the $90.00 repair fee.  Instead of sending Fuji $90.00 I sent Canon a little more for a much better camera.Save you time and money and do not buy a Fuji product.

Reviews.Title: This camera is NOT Waterproof
Reviews.Author: g. boyd
Reviews.Content: I was very excited about purchasing this camera. My husband and I are avid paddlers and we thought this would be great to take with us canoeing. When we planned a trip to the beach on Labor Day of 2009 we decided to take advantage of the waterproof feature and take pictures of fish. It worked for a day until it got water in it. We did not even take it into deep water. This was only a couple of weeks after I purchased the camera and the first time I had used it for its intended purpose.I sent it in for repairs under warranty. When a refurbished camera was returned to me the flash did not work. I sent it back and received another refurbished camera. We returned to Florida again in 2010. This was the first time I tried using the camera underwater. This time it would not even turn on when I tried to take a picture because - you guessed it - it got water in it.When I contacted Fuji again - they said they would repair it but they would charge me because it was no longer under warranty. I also learned that there is a year warranty until you get it repaired then its reduced to three months. So after I purchased the camera, had to get it repaired less than a month later, my warranty was reduced by more that 70% - does that make any sense? No. I will say that it did take good pictures, was easy to use - just don't take it in the water. But now I have a useless camera and will have to pay to get it repaired. I will NEVER purchase another Fuji camera.

Reviews.Title: Waterproofing failed; Runaround from Fuji on Warranty Repair
Reviews.Author: S. Roberts
Reviews.Content: We've had the camera for 5 months, it worked ok for a small snap and shoot.  The 3rd time in the water ( < 3ft underwater) it leaked inside and ruined the camera.  We called Fujifilm and were told by their rep that we could not get warranty service since we had not mailed in the warranty card within 30 days of purchase.  After quick online research I found that to be a total lie!  However they do REQUIRE you to send your warranty card with the camera for service, so do not discard it.  Before sending the camera I took detailed photos of the condition as another reviewer was told theirs was cracked when it was not.  At best I expect to receive a refurbished unit that has previously failed and I expect it to not hold water either.Having to get warranty repair is not a major deal, but receiving a run-around about it is - I'll never purchase another Fujifilm product and I suggest you do not either.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: J. Sweaney
Reviews.Content: ive had this camera for over a year now and have taken it with me almost everywhere.pros:1. waterproof, sand and dust proof and can survive drops.i have dropped this camera countless times the first time it fell the top left corner cracked alittle and the second time put a dent on the edge of the battery cover its covered in slight scratches but none on the lens or the back screen cause i have a screen protector on it. its still just as waterproof as before as well as dust proof and i really test the waterproofness of it whenever im in water. ive also burried it in dirt a few times  and it came out just fine. altho the lock for the battery cover and the hinge were full of dirt but continuous use of it will make it as good as new again in short time. i also ran over it a few times with a wagon full of dirt while it was recording and it didnt turn of. tho when struck hard enough it will stop filming for that brief second then continue2. picture quality is good for what i use it for.very good actually and if you use flash for night shots at close images its also very good. underwater shots are just as good depending on how clear the water is but then again in murky water it picks up more than my eyes can see.3. video quality.video quality is good and you can record up to 37 minutes and 39 seconds at a time. this is not the max but thats the timer it gives you each time you start recording. you can record as much as you want as long as you have enough memory.4. controls.the controls are very easy once you get used to them their big and easy to press while in the water5. sizethe size is super compact. and will fit in your pocket easily. and weighs next to nuthing. this is an ideal camera to take with you daily cause you wont even notice it there, well not unless your wearing super tight pants...now for the cons.1. battery life.battery life for the most part isnt to bad the battery will last u a decent amount of time if your only taking pictures. i got about 100+ at a car show before the battery died. then again i was filming as well. filming eats the battery really fast. luckily recharging it only takes about 2 hours and your good to go. you can also buy a second battery just in case. but sometimes maybe this is just me but the charger doesnt connect to the battery all the way sometimes and the light just blinks for hours.2. lanyard.for one its to short to wrap securely around your wrist and also hold the camera comfotably while in the water in case you mite drop it and its gone forever. plus its kind of thin and might break eventually. so i removed it and replaced it with a neck lanyard, works great.3. lcd screen.it's good but not great in low light images come up really grainy when the picture itself comes out just fine. thats the only problem i have4. zoom.the zoom is good but dont expect to get super close to far away objects (its only a 3x after all) but heres why for me its a con. you cannot zoom in and out while filming. you can zoom in or out before you press record but not while you are doing it. for me this sucks cause i use this mainly to record.5. video/picture transfer.not really a con but get annoying sometimes. pictures and videos are kept in the same folder. not really a biggy but when your trying to separate them sometimes u miss one or to and cant find it cause its in a different folder on you computer.overall this is a great camera that will survive just about any accidental drops into concrete or water. and if you feel like burying it go ahead. it can take that to.

Reviews.Title: Case leaked first time used underwater...
Reviews.Author: A Family Doc
Reviews.Content: ...and beware of return policies. We bought thru an Amazon supplier, Adorama. Their return policy completely excludes underwater cameras. They directed us to contact Fujifilm directly.  Have so far been trying for a week: phone system goes into an endless voicemail loop with apparently non-existent operator; no response thus far to email. Will update if/when ever get response, but so far very unhappy with service.

Reviews.Title: Best decision I ever made!
Reviews.Author: Desert Snorkeler
Reviews.Content: I was heading to Maui for some snorkeling and wanted an affordable, quality underwater camera. After weeks of research, and countless customer reviews,I finally settled on the Fujifilm Fine Pix Z33WP. I even went out on a limb and purchased the refurbished model.I was VERY nervous the first day I took it out. I couldn't believe that a camera that cost me so little would be truly submersible. It didn't take me long to realize how great this camera is. I cannot say enough positive things about it!I vowed to tell everyone I know how happy I am with this camera. It is lightweight, attractive, and takes great photos!If you are on the fence about what camera to buy...jump off and get the Fujifilm. You will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: best waterproof camera for the price!!!
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm FinePix Z33WP 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Green) I purchase this camera for a trip we went on a cruise ship,the waterproof work as it best,the camera slack of some features,but for someone the most important thing is just capture those special moment without worry of water damage their be love expensive digital cameras ,this is the way to go!  My camera went to some tough test! we went to Dumm river fall in Jamaica, during the claiming of the fall I hit the camera again some rock,nothing hard but still my brand new camera still work perfect no damage was so ever.On Cozumel mexico we went snorkeling;forgetting put the strap on my wrist the camera slip out of my hand and end up of the bottom sandy floor around 15 feet deep(despite of the max deep of 3M(9feet)the owner manual recommend)no water get inside.Again great purchase for the price an purpose of this camera!

Reviews.Title: GOT A BAD ONE?
Reviews.Author: rbh
Reviews.Content: 23 pictures and it quit.  I purchased it for outdoors, but no intent to get it wet.  Pics OK until enlarged.  I have a cheaper older 6 mx camera that does much better.  Bummer is when I called the not so friendly toll-free# advised it would be min 3wks for return.  Buying the Canon version as my neighbor's is far superior.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA FOR THE PRICE!
Reviews.Author: Jason A. Burgess
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a secondary camera for a trip to Barbados because I wanted something waterproof but did not want to spend a lot of money.  This camera was very impressive.  I am usually a DSLR person but this camera is so portable and durable it is hard to argue against it.  It now goes everywhere with me just in case.  I have not taken it diving but have taken it in rain storms and out in the ocean with me swimming and it works great.  If you are looking for a low priced water proof camera this is it.

Reviews.Title: waterproof???
Reviews.Author: betty
Reviews.Content: This camera was a terrible purchase. The first time it got in contact with water, it stoped working. I returned to the seller and have not recieved my money back. Hope it happens soon

Reviews.Title: for wakeboarding
Reviews.Author: Eric G. Kishi "wakeskater447"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and I have taken it on rafting trips and snowskiing as well.Only bad thing is that in the continous shot mode it is really really slow.  I bought this camera so I could use it for action wakeboard shots from the inner tube behind the boat while people jump over.  But it is so hard to time a single shot it gets frustrating.I think I am going to get the olympus waterproof as their continous shot is really fast.But all in all if you just want this camera to be waterproof for simple shots around water or snow its perfect.

Reviews.Title: Takes washed out blurry pics
Reviews.Author: c0rwyn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take fly fishing.  I had no intentions of taking underwater pics.  I just wanted something that wouldn't get ruined if I dropped it in the drink.  When I got the camera I took several photos in various lighting conditions.  I examined the pics and they were all very blurry, grainy, and had a yellow tinge to them.  I tried several settings on the camera to include the 'anti shake' setting in case it was me causing the blurry pics.  Just to compare I got my 9MP Lumix that I bought a couple of years ago and took an identical photo with it and the Fuji.  Both pictures were taken with a flash and with no zoom.  My Lumix pic turned out really well.  It was lit great with no washout and the picture was crisp with lots of detail.  The Fuji pic was horrible.  It was blurry and grainy.  I couldn't make out any detail at all.  A friend suggested that I may have gotten a lemon and to trade it in for a replacement.  But I have to pay return shipping so I just got an RMA number.  Even with the 15% restocking fee, it's not worth keeping this piece of junk.  Try a different camera if you don't want to gamble with your money.

Reviews.Title: works great underwater!
Reviews.Author: J. Logston
Reviews.Content: Got this for my daughter for her 8th grade graduation.  It is durable, takes great photos and works very well underwater.  Now my son wants one!!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher Miller
Reviews.Content: Took this camera on my trip to Cozumel.  I saw a few other people with the same camera taking pictures underwater.Pros:Absolutely AMAZING underwater photosTotally waterproof...even to 10 feet under waterPictures on land are good too, but you have to be in the right picture modeCons:Not much reallyGrainy night shots (but what camera does take decent night shots???)

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Z33 waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Larry Stout
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. Spent a week in Jamaica and got some great shots. Good battery life. Light weight. Adequate zoom function. Well worth the price and much better than buying disposable waterproof cameras. Good pics out of the water as well. Would recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: GA Mom
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for the specific purpose of taking it on vacation with my family this summer.  I have used it at Sea World, water parks, in pools, and in the rain at DisneyWorld...it works great outdoors.  Indoors, however, it does not have the best picture quality.  I use my DSLR for those pics, instead.  When I was shopping around for a waterproof camera, I was deciding between this one and a similarly priced Olympus one.  I chose this one because it was cheaper and seemed to have better customer reviews.  I have not been disappointed.  It has served the purpose for which I bought it...to take vacation photos at locations with water.

Reviews.Title: Great little waterproof
Reviews.Author: Charles H. Sowell "outdoor enthusiast"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality and waterproofing have been beyond my expectations. I've had some problems with the battery/memory card portal door and autofocus could be faster, but overall this is a very good product and well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix Z33WP 10MP Waterproof Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Audra Ritter "umduh"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year ago and I still really like it. During the winter, I dropped it and the inside lens broke, so it's hard to look at my pics because of the cracked screen, but it still takes great pics and videos.

Reviews.Title: great for kayak
Reviews.Author: redclay
Reviews.Content: I have been a loyal fuji user and I am not disappointed with this waterproof camera. I bought it for kayaking, slim design makes it easy to tuck into a lifejacket pocket. Less worries bringing it along for a day at the beach than a non waterproof model.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: H. Blum "Snorkler"
Reviews.Content: I used this camera during a recent trip to Hawaii.  I must have taken it on 5 snorkel trips.  The battery did great and the camera is 100% waterproof (even at good depths).  The biggest issues are photo clarity (which I think is difficult for most cameras underwater) and length of time to get the shot.  The shutter is very slow.  You probably need to hold it down for a good 2-3 seconds in order to get the shot and by then the shots are usually long gone.  For example, we were watching dolphins doing tricks coming out of the water.  I must have taken 100 shots and none of them came out because the dolphin had already gone back under.However, I still loved having the camera and would say it was great for the money.  You can also color correct a lot of the photos on a photo site (like Snapfish) so they are a lot crisper.  If I had to do it over again, I would buy the same camera despite its few flaws.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the money
Reviews.Author: S. Gnatz "Jazz Dr"
Reviews.Content: Overall, I think that this camera has performed very well in the first month I have owned it. I bought it to take to Florida on a spring break trip with the kids. It is very waterproof (no leaks) and took all the abuse that my teenagers could throw at it. It is fun to use under water. The picture quality is good considering the small lens and the fact that people tend to smear their fingerprints on the front glass. A quick wipe with a soft dry towel every once and a while helps with picture quality, I found. Criticisms? A few. The battery life is only fair. I found that I would sometimes have to stop and charge it after only a half day sitting by the pool. Of course, the kids were not only shooting but looking at the pictures on the LCD screen, re-playing movies, etc. It takes about an hour for the battery to charge up again. One of first things that happened was that the LCD screen on the camera got scratched on the first day out - which doesn't affect the picture quality, of course - but I just wish that it had been more resistant to abrasion. Also, there are now several corners on the body where the black enamel is worn off due to being thrown, dropped etc. -  but you get the idea of the type of torture this little camera took and has stood up to astonishingly well so far. Also positive, the menu is very intuitive - you will not miss the paper instruction book if you have any familiarity with digital cameras at all. The delay between the time you press the shutter release and the time that the image is captured seems about average for a point-and-shoot (i.e. slow). But a very cool feature is the bracketing (top 3 frames) option that captures several frames in rapid succession and then lets you pick the best one. I caught the kids in mid-air jumping into the pool easily using this feature - most other cameras at this price (and more) would have missed the shot completely.  Oh, and also being somewhat picky, I wish that the on-off button and the shutter release were not quite so close together - several times I shut the camera down by mistake instead of taking a snapshot until I got used to the proximity of these buttons. Overall though, it seems like the FinePix Z33WP is a nice tough little waterproof kid-proof camera. Well worth the money in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Jackie Wein
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for a hard-to-please sixteen-year-old's birthday.  She is thrilled with it and has been Scuba diving on her Hawaiian vacation just so she can take underwater photos.  I understand the results are excellent.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Jackie "SpunkGirl2004"
Reviews.Content: I went to Maui last year and snorkeled off Molokini and was in awe of the colors and clarity out there. Having had bad luck with the single-use waterproof cameras in the past (horrible photos, expensive to buy the camera and then have the prints done, only to find them blurry), I decided I'd look for a waterproof camera that wasn't too expensive.When I saw one reviewer's video, I was sold on the Fuji FinePix Z33WP. I got it really fast and started shooting here on dry land right away, just to get an idea of the quality. I am NOT disappointed at all! I took shot some pictures both inside and out; a few of the pets in the house and of some flowers in the yard. I got an 'extreme' closeup of a dandelion that came out so sharp and clear, it was just unbelievable!Now, I cannot WAIT to get to Hawaii in May and take it out into the ocean...I will return with another review at that time! But, for now, so far, so good!Fujifilm FinePix Z33WP 10 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Black)

Reviews.Title: leaked water first time we went snorkeling.  Very disappointing
Reviews.Author: R. Thompson
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera and all the additional acessories for a trip to Hawaii and it leaked water the first time we took it with us snorkeling.  Because we bought extra batteries we decided to purchase the same camera at a local store.  Even though the second camera worked okay, the trip was half way over and we missed so much. If I had to do it over again, I would have paid more and had the pictures.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Rebecca M. Tapia "happy"
Reviews.Content: It is pretty handy little camera and takes pretty decent pictures overall. It just really stinks that you have to take the battery out to charge it. The flash works great but sometimes is a little over powering and it's hard to find the right setting where you can see with out it being to dark or to washed out. but overall a really good little camera.

Reviews.Title: first waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: M. Moore
Reviews.Content: I just received my camera. It's a lot smaller then what i was expecting. So far I really like it took a few pictures around the house and so far so good. Taking the pictures looking at the display they look a little grainy but the pictures weren't. I filled up the sink and tried it worked great! Great camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: Kristin L. Borst
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing, cute and perfect. I have found nothing wrong with it so far. I bought it to have a handy point and shoot camera so I wouldn't have to carry my Rebel into "situations" where it would be bothersome.The photo quality is great, I haven't printed anything out yet. It does have a manual setting so I can fine tune my pics before using the camera.  Alot of the previous reviewers talked about noise in the images, but I have yet to see any of that.  Also I don't use the programmed settings and manually set the camera to the ISO, image size, etc.The battery charger is nice, it's a wall-mount so there are no extra cords to lug around. The battery does have to be removed to be charged, but I don't find this to be annoying at all because this is what I have to do with my Rebel.I haven't had a chance to use it in the water, and I'm a little hesitant.The size of the camera is roughly the size of a blackberry, but a little thicker.  It fits perfectly in pocket, possibly better than my cell phone does.I'll update this once I've used my camera more.

Reviews.Title: Best little digi camera I've owned to date!
Reviews.Author: Siobhan Macfarlane "Chev"
Reviews.Content: I have gone through quite a few digital cameras in the past few years 6 to be exact! I am just really rough with them, I hike and kayak and do crazy things with them and I need one that would be able to handle my crazy adventures and still take some great pictures!I picked this camera over the shock proof ones mainly because of its price. But I have been so satisfied with it, I've had it for about 3 months now.So far I used it on vacation, in the water maybe 2-3 feet with no issues, and that was a pool, I tried it out in the ocean just below the water line maybe 6-10 inches and the pictures came out pretty awesome! The video's take some great footage, and the sound quality was impressive.The only negative aspect is that when taking pictures inside they tend to be a bit grainy, but my main use for the camera is for outdoors so I am not bothered at all by it!Its pretty durable as well, as it was able to survive a week of drunken nights on a cruise, which includes being dropped off numerous tables and stepped on and it is still functioning great!I would recommend this to anyone looking for a good outdoor camera, that actually is, waterproof and durable!  :)

Reviews.Title: Horrible Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: T. Shaw
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this camera, but imediatley after uploading my first pictures i was very disappointed.  The picture quality is very poor.

Reviews.Title: Great, durable waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Steven Nelson
Reviews.Content: Purchased this prior to our trip to Hawaii and was not disappointed.  Worked great underwater in fresh and saltwater. Fairly durable, we dropped it around 4 ft a couple times onto pavement and no scratches or damage noted. The video quality (640x480 max) is surprisingly good above and below water (pleasantly surprised by audio capability and quality underwater). Buttons on the back seem pretty durable but takes some getting used to.  One of the onscreen menus has a large variety shooting modes that seemed to work well for their purpose (underwater, fireworks, beach, etc...).  Main drawback as noted by other reviewers is the poor image quality in low and medium light shooting. If using a flash, be sure to have the subject within 10ft or so.  We have a Sony point-and-shoot purchased for a comparable price that does much better in low light.  If you're looking for a durable underwater camera with great video with a choice of cool colors, this is it!

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Johnsy "jba"
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with the camera the first time I used it. The pictures came out crisp and clean. The shutter speed is something I was looking for. Its fast and quick and you don't miss a shot because you have to wait for the shutter to finally click. The camera is small and easy to take with any where and to just drop it in your purse or pocket. I love that it comes in colors, I have the green one. Up loading your pictures to your computer is also fast and quick. Good Camera for the price. I haven't gotten a chance to see how the waterproof part of the camera works yet. If it protects my pictures that will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: the best fishing camera yet
Reviews.Author: D. Miller "musky_D"
Reviews.Content: I've had this Fuji out in the cold fishing bluecats for the last couple months, and it has held up fine and taken some great pics of people with fish.  I even printed a 10 X 8.  The colors and detail are brilliant.  The lady at the digital processing center even commented the pics looked great.I also added on the silicon skin and floating wrist lanyard (brilliant accessories) to protect it for the long term.  I've kept it out in 20 degree temps, had it out in the cold rain, dropped it several times, and used it with slimy, scaly hands.  I simply slip the skin off, wash it, and you'd think the Fuji was a week old camera again.I am impressed.

Reviews.Title: GREAT WATERPROOF CAMERA
Reviews.Author: GLOMASTER "GLOMASTER"
Reviews.Content: GREAT GREAT GREAT CAMERA. Waterproof to depths that it advertises. Fast shooting, fast flash recharge, good battery life, and great pics under water. Also the videos under water turned out great. For the price I would recommend this camera to anyone. I have owned 2 sonys, 3 cannons, and 2 fujis, and for the price, this camera really competes.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Boots
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use; small and compact. Did not realize that the video had sound.  Have not tried it in the water yet. Great little camera for the price.  Also bought one for a gift.

Reviews.Title: Nice Digital Camera for Underwater
Reviews.Author: George "geoherb"
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe I was buying another Fuji camera after the troubles my old own gave me. That one will not work in hot temperatures. But since we were going on a cruise and we kayak a lot, I knew an underwater model would be best.The Fuji FinePix Z33WP worked well. The menus are easy to use, although I saw a woman use a camera with much easier to use controls at a concert. I was fumbling around with the Fuji in the dark while she was manipulating her camera's controls with ease. I should have asked her what brand hers was.My cruise photos turned out pretty well. The picture quality is quite good for almost all my outdoor shots. Indoor shots varied greatly. Some are fine quality, some I had to tweak in Photoshop, and some are beyond help. The best ones tend to be close up shots. The underwater shots also vary in quality. Some of the problem may be my inexperience in using the camera while snorkeling. I managed to take some great shots underwater, however, and am pleased with the camera's performance.The small size makes this camera easy to slip into a pocket. Battery life has not been an issue. I ordered a spare to keep with me. The video works well.

Reviews.Title: Versatile, well-built point and shoot
Reviews.Author: F. Madeira
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a 10 year old, but I often use it myself because it's actually a very good point and shoot camera.  The build quality and tactile feel is very good.  We've taken it to the beach (in the surf), water parks and have used it underwater in the pool.  It does not look like the typical underwater camera, but it is amazingly water tight.  I highly recommend the clear neoprene cover that comes with the kit, as well as the float wrist strap.  The cover does a good job of protecting it from bumps and the float strap keeps it above water in case it slips out of your hand.  This camera can go places most other camera's can't.Image quality is very good, but not on the level of a quality DSLR like my other camera, a Nikon D40 -  you clearly notice the differences.  The video feature of the camera is fantastic.  It's great for capturing those spontaneous moments.  I find myself reaching for this camera before I grab my mini DV camcorder.  The videos upload right to my computer along with the photos.The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was the less than perfect picture quality.  If you're looking for a well built, versatile camera that can handle the elements quite well, this is certainly worth considering.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for your water adventures
Reviews.Author: S. Montgomery
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for water use on our vacation.  The camera is easy to you, handles and shoots well. It went snorkeling, down water slides and in the pool. The photos were a good quality and sound was surprisingly clear on the videos.  Even though the intention was to use the camera in the water only, out of the water did well too.Overall a fun camera at a good price.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING camera
Reviews.Author: Kristy L. Manrrique "rrique"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take with us to Disneyworld.  I used it the whole time for regular pictures and water pics.  Its rounded edges slid in and out of my pocket easily.  The picture quality is awesome and since the zoom lens in behind a shield I could wipe it with a wet one and not worry about scratching the lens or no fingerprints.  I love that I can still do vidoes too AND play them back and hear them!  I took video of me and my son going down a waterslide and its a great memory I will always cherish.  VERY please with this camera and I have recommended it to ALL of my friends!

Reviews.Title: No regrets!
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Birindelli
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a trip to Hawaii.  I knew that I was going to do a lot of snorkeling and wasn't happy with the quality of the disposables in the past.  I was very impressed with how easy this camera was to use while being underwater and the picture quality was good.I also went on a parasailing trip.  They wouldn't allow my regular digital camera in case it got wet.  I pulled out the Fuji underwater and took it up with me.  Even out of the water, the pictures turned out great.For the price point, I fully recommend this camera for anyone wanting a good point and  shoot for basic underwater pictures.If I had to say anything negative thing about this camera, I would recommend something with a better zoom.  Also, get an underwater strap that will secure the camera to your wrist.

Reviews.Title: Fits nicely in hands, takes great pictures and video
Reviews.Author: Sylvie
Reviews.Content: I waited to write a review until I felt I had taken enough pictures and video to have a solid opinion.  My first thoughts when I got this camera were how comfortably it fit in my hands, and how easy the buttons are to push.  I do have smaller hands though.  Now that I've taken it on a vacation to Florida, I can also say it takes great pictures in any setting and the videos turn out bright and clear as well.  I love that you can watch the video on the camera itself, as it does have a speaker so you can hear the sound.  Printed pictures have also turned out beautifully.  It is so convenient to be able to use just one camera for both water and land pictures, whether indoor or outdoor.  I would definitely recommend this camera, especially for someone who travels often to places that a waterproof/underwater camera would be convenient.  I am looking forward to using it on more vacations as well in every day life and am glad I won't have to buy a new disposable waterproof camera every time I go on vacation.  In the long run, this camera is definitely a great value for me.

Reviews.Title: decent quality for the price, but don't expect too much
Reviews.Author: I. Wu
Reviews.Content: bought this camera a couple of weeks ago, took it to Hanauma Bay in Hawaii and took some out of the water and underwater pictures. Not the best quality, but they were decent for the price. Out of the water picture quality was pretty good, but the cannon's definitely takes better quality photos.use it for a quick zap, don't expect too much.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix Z33WP Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Wade "Jim Wade"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera!  The size is handy, and the features are awesome.  Took some underwater pix that turned out great.  I have made some mistakes in selecting settings but am learning.  Do wish the display was easier to see in bright light.  Overall it's an extremely good value.

Reviews.Title: Great product at a great price
Reviews.Author: K. S. Kofton
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for an upcoming trip to the Bahamas which will include some snorkeling. I have a very nice camera but it is very large and not waterproof. Figured I would give this one a chance for the price and would be great just to have in my purse whenever wanted. We used the camera this weekend at a pool party and plesantly surprised at the quality of both water and non water photos. Everyone at the party now wants to buy one and was very impressed. Great value and great product for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great little under water camera
Reviews.Author: S. Kwan
Reviews.Content: The Z33WP is great for any vacations involving WATER!!!  Just the right price and can do what my DSLR can never do -- Going anywhere I go and snapping picture just for fun.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: elisa stricklen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my niece for her graduation.. and i find myself stealing it from her so that i can use it! i love it! the pic quality is amazing! I'm definitely buying one for myself soon!

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: Roberto Deleon
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted something for the outdoors, so far I already took this camera to two water parks and take great pictures and video too. No complaints at all, I love it!!

Reviews.Title: not so waterproof
Reviews.Author: Lindy Dohmen-harter "Lindy D"
Reviews.Content: I love this camara and i love the quality, but it is not as waterproof as everyone says. I went swimming today and took a picture underwater what it apparently can do, my camara won't turn on and make horrible noises and it just keeps flashing!I am so dissapointed and doubting if i want to buy it again.

Reviews.Title: My new waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Debbie Turner "Radtech"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera have not tested it underwater yet. I hope all goes well. Good picture, but slow shutter speed.  Have enjoyed it so far.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Sloan
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews before deciding on this camera. I am a hobby photographer and new not to go into this purchase expecting the quality of my Nikon D7000 SLR, but still wanting decent photos without a large price. I have been pleased with the pictures/videos from this camera so far. I have not had the opportunity to use it in bright natural sunlight. I have only used it in indoor hotel pools at night and was still shocked by the quality of the photos in those conditions. I am excited to have a camera I feel comfortable taking to the waterpark this summer with my family and something to use snorkeling in the Caribbean on my honeymoon this fall. I think the outdoor pictures with the bright sunlight will be even better than the indoor lighting I have had to use thus far.I have felt comfortable letting kids use it in the water. They range in age from 10-17 and they can get a little crazy playing in the pool, but this camera has held up to that.I love the color of the camera too.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: C. Alexander "DC"
Reviews.Content: I've taken this camera on a couple of beach trips. Works great and takes pretty good pictures. Haven't had any problems with using in water. Love the size, very compact and easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Great for underwater, decent for dry
Reviews.Author: Jillian K. Barker "~Jilly"
Reviews.Content: Takes AMAZING underwater pictures!! Definitely worth it!! Not the best zoom though. For most settings it's fantastic. Good video too.

Reviews.Title: Great little waterproof camera!
Reviews.Author: Joy
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd camera, same model. My first one lasted me about 2 years and when I visited the Philippines, a relative asked to have it as his birthday present. My second one is about 3 years old now. I use it in the water and out of the water. I am happy with the quality of the pictures. The only reason why i'll upgrade is that this can only go about 3meters and I will eventually want one that can go deeper. Otherwise, it's a great camera. I'm happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera with not so great controls.
Reviews.Author: Simon Medisch
Reviews.Content: It works like it should but the controls are clunky. Bought for vacation to Hawaii, takes better pictures than I expected, now it's the camera I give my kids to use because it's tough.

Reviews.Title: Water Damage
Reviews.Author: Brad Wilhite
Reviews.Content: This camera worked marginally around the streams and rivers i fished in, I know, its not a $1000 camera. One trip into the ocean and it was water logged and completely destroyed. Still have not figured out how but seeing as it was a WATERPROOF CAMERA I sure would have expected a bit more.

Reviews.Title: excellent  they meet all my expectations
Reviews.Author: Jaime Zuluaga
Reviews.Content: I can recommend this product to others  who practice outdoors sports  not only waters sports than you color was perfect

Reviews.Title: Ordered in 2009 and still works
Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: I have had bad luck with all the cameras I have bought.  This one was bought for my sons 8th birthday back in 2009.  It still works fine.  It has been dropped quite a bit so parts are breaking off but still works.  Also it does now have a part on the camera that for some reason shows up foggy in the pictures.  Not sure if its because it has gotten splashed.  I never put it completely in water even though its water proof.  I am pretty impressed that its still alive.  haha  Better than the ones you spend 500 bucks on just for it to stop working in less than a year.  An 8 year olds camera lasting longer than his mom's...hmmmm issue there.  haha.  Well I use it a lot too. It has been used almost on a daily basis.

Reviews.Title: Lost all my pictures
Reviews.Author: Garfield
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Amazon about 2 years ago. My intention was to use it on vacations and not carry the heavy SLR. From day one the battery cover didn't close easily. I had to check the cover every time. I used the camera at the sea and pools most of the time. At the end of year 2 cover opened by itself at sea and I lost about 1000 vacation pictures. I should have returned it day one.I set up the timer for 2 minute in activity. The GPS had never registered the location.The outdoors pictures were great. The night pictures had orange color with lots of noise.Very slow to shoot indoor or outdoors, most of the time the moment is lost.I won't buy another Fuji camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVED THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: kestrelk8
Reviews.Content: I LOVED THIS CAMERA! Best camera ever made? No. Especially on land. However, I think that's to be expected given that it's made primarily for use in the water. And take PHENOMENAL underwater shots and video it did!!! For the price it was a steal. Too bad I dropped mine in the ocean in Mexico last December because from what I understand, they made some changes to the most recent model that have made it not that great. Prior to Mexico this camera has been snorkeling in Hawaii several times, floating on the river, out on the boat...and survived it all. I am generally not gentle with these things either. WISH THEY WOULD BRING IT BACK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful!
Reviews.Author: K. Hassett
Reviews.Content: I had purchased this for my graduation keeping in my mind my water-based vacations, most of which with children.  I didn't intend it to be held underwater but thought it was an investment in case of dropping it in water.  It has really clear pictures, although a slow shutter speed sometimes, and it's pretty durable!  I have dropped it in an out of water, and aside from some scratches it's fine.  The screen even held up to dropping.  I did eventually take under water pictures, and those came out really well!  You do need clear clean water for them though, the sand and muck from ponds, rivers, and lakes will show up.  I'd reccomend it to anyone who goes near or in water and is prone to having devices get ruined via water damage.

Reviews.Title: Bad, Bad, Bad underwater experience
Reviews.Author: xjf123
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to Cancun for snorkeling, with high expectations. And it fails me.I followed every step as the instruction and double checked the battery chamber is securely locked before I get into the water and you know what? It still leaks.I visually saw the bubbles coming out from the camera and the there is water level increasing in between the LCD and back cover. Slowly though, but it's leaking. I took as much photo as I can before it went down. But the rest of the trip I have missed so many good shots.DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA IF YOU ARE SERIOUSLY THINKING ABOUT UNDERWATER PHOTOGRAPHING!!!

Reviews.Title: serves the purpose
Reviews.Author: Patricia Deslauriers
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camers for shooting pictures outdoors, at the beach, in a boat, etc. It takes great outdoor pictures, The pictures inside are just so-so. I like it for the fact that it is water proof and you can bang it up pretty good and it still works. The reason I gave it only 3 stars though is because the button you push to take a picture acts weird. Almost like a delay or something. Unless you get used to how it works it won't take a picture. When I hand it to someone and ask them to take a picture they usually can't do it. That's annoying but other than that it serves the purpose for outdoors.

Reviews.Title: great for outdoor, but not for indoor
Reviews.Author: bargainx
Reviews.Content: very dark & blurry when I use it inside the aquarium even with the SR Auto and battery life is bad after a year.  However, underwater/outdoor are good. I take it to my vacation all the time.

Reviews.Title: Happy birthday to me...
Reviews.Author: Katherine R. Gloystein "shaid"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a birthday present for myself a few years ago.  It's been a good camera; I use it fairly often and have no trouble uploading my photos to my laptop.  My husband refers to it as "the Jolly Rancher"; it is a very green camera.  The only issue is that I often forget to charge it!  Oops!  It did a great job taking a 30 min video of my friends' wedding!  I was quite pleased with how that turned out.As for water proofness... I wasn't aware it was supposed to be.  We took a whole slew of photos in Seattle this March and had no trouble (except for the "forgetting to charge it" one).  All in all, a good camera for a non-photographer.

Reviews.Title: Fuji FinePix Z33WP
Reviews.Author: Mark F. Squires "Mark"
Reviews.Content: Camera broke within 6 months... Very sensitive to shock and vibration.. Not too bad if you keep it in bubble wrap ALL THE TIME!!!!

Reviews.Title: camera lasted about a year
Reviews.Author: James J. Yost
Reviews.Content: camera was bought new, worked ok for about a year. just out of warranty started doing weird things, not keeping adjusments and pretty much doing whatever it wants. , now has a smear, blue line in the view finder and in the photos. pretty much worthless now. i would try another brand, fuji won't even look at the camera for less than $75 bucks, ,, may try a different model next or cheaper camera.

Reviews.Title: Finepix Fuji Z33wp
Reviews.Author: Huey Dinh
Reviews.Content: Nice and compact camera for the beach. The video quality is very good for the money. In fact, I can retire my Canon DV camcorder now. Night shots with flash is not the best, but you really need a bigger flash any way. I like it very much as a supplement for my DSLR.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Hairbear
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for taking under water pictures, although you need to get close to the item to get a good detail.  I use it all the time when I go snorkling!

Reviews.Title: awesome little guy
Reviews.Author: Tifany Leigh-Logan
Reviews.Content: One battery lasted my entire visit to England, I took 3 minute long videos and over 400 photos and looked through the photos with friends many times. It was amazing. I haven't tried it out in water yet but love it so far.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my 23 year old son
Reviews.Author: Shelley
Reviews.Content: My son wanted a camera that he could take duck and deer hunting.  It had to be durable, take good pictures, take a quick shot, and handle the elements.  I got him the Fujifilm for his birthday and he has thanked me 3 times in the last couple of weeks - he loves it!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera with good results
Reviews.Author: J. Bucci "J. Bucci"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera to supplement our DSLR camera as it has underwater ability. We decided on our recent trip to Disney World to take only this Fuji and not the DSLR so as to not "weigh" us down during long days at the park. We were not disappointed. I did find that the scene recognition mode wasn't as good as the auto mode for general photo taking and left the camera on auto mode for most pictures. And I captured some awesome photos of Cinderella's castle lit up with the fireworks framing the castle (the camera was set to the night mode and placed on a monopod). We haven't tested the camera's underwater ability yet but did take it to the waterpark where it certainly got wet but not submerged. All photos were sharp and bright. I think for the price this camera is a good deal and will make most average point and shooters pretty happy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Michele Ramunni
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, sharp picture, easy to use and light. Only problem doesn't have a view finder and in sunlight it's just point and shoot and hope it comes out ok.

Reviews.Title: Love my new little camera!
Reviews.Author: Joyce Schaubroeck "Joyce"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera a few days before we went on vacation. I think the pictures are great for an inexpensive light weight camera. I was worried about it being waterproof, but after 10 days of snorkeling and sailing, no problems so far. I would buy it again!

Reviews.Title: Exceeded our expectations -- great underwater and on land.
Reviews.Author: Coral Reefer
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for a trip to Maui anticipating that we would do a lot of snorkeling.  We were very pleased with the pictures it took.  It's a bit tricky taking photos underwater but we got some sharp and clear images of coral, fish, and even turtles.  What surprised us was how good the camera was out of water.  It has "Sunset" and "Flower" (macro) modes that yieled very nice images.  When we next go on a similar trip we will take this camera and also buy the latest version of it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Naty18
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera only for under-water use because I thought that considering the price the pictures wouldn't be so great, so I could use my previous camera for other pictures. But I was very surprised to realize that it's amazing, the pictures are great, the resolution is perfect, you can take great pictures even while moving and the colors look amazing (especially when taking close-ups of flowers). I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Simply Amazing
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing and you CAN'T beat this price! 10 MP and waterproof. My husband and I have had so much fun taking this camera to the pool, kayaking, and fishing, and everyone thinks it is the greatest thing ever. 3 of our friends are buying this camera now too, and I would recommend it to EVERYONE!

Reviews.Title: Incredible quality!!!!
Reviews.Author: Tailgater
Reviews.Content: I am thoroughly impressed with the quality of this camera. For the price point of this camera I wasn't expecting too much but it blew me away how clear the pictures were. I bought this camera for snorkeling in the Caribbean and the pictures turned out very clean.The video quality also is excellent as well. I recommend this product 100%.

Reviews.Title: Good overall camera
Reviews.Author: N. McDonald "Nat!"
Reviews.Content: I'm a pretty abusive camera owner so I will take that into effect here.  I bought this camera as a replacement for my Kodak P&S; that I ruined at the beach. I spend a lot of time near the water swimming, kayaking, rafting, etc... and a lot of time in rough conditions like sports fields, beach, purse...  This camera was onsale for a very good price (assuming because of the color) so I couldn't pass it up.  I've taken it in the pool, on the kayak, in the ocean and to the field with no problems.  The way the back is constructed leaves no where for sand and dirt to get in.  It also comes with a removable and rechargable battery which is a HUGE perk for me.  I hated how quickly my last camera went through expensive camera batteries.  Now I just pop it out and charge it before I head out and not worry about it.Picture quality is pretty good...has it's ups and downs but is still good overall.  Sometimes a bad picture is due to a smudge or water drop on the lens which is easy to wipe off, and just as easy to wipe on with the flush lens.  Also if I try to snap the picture too quickly, before the camera has time to focus... it tends to be blurry.  This is when trying to snap a picture back to back, and could also be due to my unsteadiness. The menu is pretty easy to naviagte and the camera is just the right size (I don't like the weightless, creditcard thin cameras... too easy to drop).  I've had no problems with the camera or video quality.I'm very happy with my purchase and have had a few people ask where they can find the same camera.  I would buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Kimster
Reviews.Content: great little camera, is for a young child and it's easy for her to take pictures.  spend alot of time at water parks in the summer and the camera's waterproof feature makes taking it along a must.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Purchase!
Reviews.Author: The D's
Reviews.Content: My husband and I purchased this camera for our trip to Hawaii. I purposely waited to write this review until we returned so that I had a thorough review to give. The camera lived up to every expectation! It was great for all of the snorkeling we did and not only took great underwater pictures, but the recording feature works awesome too! This is hands down, one of the best and most affordable investments we made this summer! Our only wish is that the camera's zoom feature was better, but its not something we can't live with. If you're looking for something affordable and compact for underwater use, this is a great choice. :)

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Audrey
Reviews.Content: this is an wonderful camera, inexpensive, good looking, great pictures, absolutely amazing. Excellent offer. Fujifilm FinePix Z33WP 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Green)

Reviews.Title: Exellent choice for a waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Jon "Jo"
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera for about a week, but have already taken it swimming in the lake with me multiple times.  It is a nice full-featured camera that does a good job with standard picture-taking.  It really excels underwater - spectacular pictures and video.  With this camera you will not feel as though you settled for second-rate equipments just because you needed it to be waterproof.I have taken pictures above and below water during my swims.  I have also caught some nice video of underwater scenery and fish.  I swim with the camera in my pocket underwater for up to an hour, and it has no problems.  Everyone who sees the underwater images and video is impressed, and asks about my camera.  I highly recommend this camera if you plan to take pictures and capture video in, around and under the water.The only downsides for me are:1.  No real image stabilization2.  No lens cap3.  No optical viewfinder (now true with most digital cameras)For the price, performance and features you should not hesitate to purchase the Z33WP.  I love mine.

Reviews.Title: Bad refurbished
Reviews.Author: Julio Benavides Campos
Reviews.Content: The camera has good quality pictures, but the flash doesn't shoot and the battery charger never charges the battery, was over.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Edward Castro
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our Hawaiian trip thinking I was going to get pretty good pics. I had no idea that they were going to come out great! I read the reviews and the price was right. So I took a chance. Underwater pics and film were clear and bright. Lighting is important with any underwater camera. So make sure its not clouding for the best results. The controls were easy to use and this little camera also took great lively pictures on dry land.

Reviews.Title: Mix feeling - Overall does its job...
Reviews.Author: Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift and I got to tried it before I hand it over. Reality is that once you get spoil by Canon quality, it is hard to settle for anything less in terms of image quality and menu/interface advancements of Canon brand, my previous comparable Canon model was the Powershot A590 IS.The good about this little camera: It is little, very pocketable and WATER PROOF. The camera is also very inexpensive for being water proof, that is a big plus. Solid constructions, it feels solid and well built.The not so good... If you buy it directly from the vendor Adorama instead of here, you will get it cheaper $100. The bad thing, Adorama is not a reputable vendor, the camera they sent me, although it works great, it looked used, not freshly packaged and had finger prints every where.The image quality is inferior, noisy and too punchy (saturated). The images from the A590IS looked more even and natural. I was hoping for stelar battery performance since I was stepping out of the AA batteries, but to my surprise, the battery on this camera doesn't last as much either.The whole interface is kind of weird and very slow, it takes for ever to browse pictures and the interface buttons are very difficult to press, if you have big hands and you are trying to change settings in the middle of a pool or the beach where you hands and the camera are wet, good luck.Other then that, for $100, it is the perfect everyday use little camera, it fits every where and it does what it suppose to, just not a stelar performer. My point here is that if you are trying to get the best performance and image quality out of an entry level water camera, then spend an extra $100 and get the Canon version of this camera, other wise learn to live with the short comings.Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Haberman "Consultant, writer, spea...
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something I could easily carry on hikes, bike rides or just easily anywhere. It had to be water proof in case I got rained on or sweated heavily. So far this has met my needs. Pictures come out pretty nice, and it is easy to use. The only complaint is that it did not come with a memory card, I had to get that elsewhere. But it was easy enough to do.

Reviews.Title: pretty awesome
Reviews.Author: pachuu41
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend is going to the boundary waters soon and he wanted to use my camera but its not waterproof so we bought this.  We love the size, color, capabilities, picture quality.  It is a rather neat camera and pretty sturdy.

Reviews.Title: #1nana
Reviews.Author: #1nana
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for our trip to Australia.  Husband triedit out in our pool taking pictures of grandson and it worked great!Very happy with purchase and know we will get more great pictures!You won't be sorry if you purchase this camera.

Reviews.Title: great for my 12 y.o.
